question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this circular is to ensure the safety of school-going children on their way to and from school.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the important step mentioned in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The important step mentioned is to have police verification carried out in respect of the drivers and helpers etc. of buses/vans/auto-rickshaw ferrying school children.

question_answer_pairs.question: Why is it necessary to have police verification of the drivers and helpers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It is necessary to have police verification to ensure the continued safety of the children in their journey to and from the school.

question_answer_pairs.question: How often is the police verification to be repeated?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The police verification is to be repeated after every two years, to ensure continued safety of the children.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is instructed to adhere to the instructions in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All the Heads of the Govt./Govt. Aided/Primary/Secondary/Higher Secondary & Special Schools in the State of Goa are instructed to adhere to the instructions.

question_answer_pairs.question: What action will be taken against the schools in case of any violation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Stringent action will be taken against the schools in case of any violation/lapse with regard to the safety and well-being of school children.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular has been issued by the Directorate of Education, Government of Goa.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the designation of the officer who has signed this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is signed by Vandana Rao, IAS, Director of Education.

question_answer_pairs.question: When was this circular issued?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular was issued on 23/9/2019.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the circular number?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular number is No. Acad/Misc/MHRD/2017/2100.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the circular addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is addressed to the Heads of Govt./Govt. Aided/Primary/Secondary/Higher Secondary & Special Schools in the State of Goa.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for issuing this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is issued in light of the various incidents of abuse of school-going children on their way to and back from schools.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Ministry that has instructed the staff engagement for ferrying school children?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Human Resource Development, New Delhi has instructed that the staff may be engaged for ferrying school children only after police verification of their character and antecedents is completed.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for repeating the police verification every two years?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The police verification is to be repeated every two years to ensure continued safety of the children in their journey to and from the school.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the recipients of the copies of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Copies of this circular have been sent to the Joint Secretary to the Government of India, Ministry of Human Resource Development, Department of School Education & Literacy, Shastri Bhavan, New Delhi, the Dy. question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the police verification is to ensure the character and antecedents of the staff engaged for ferrying school children.

question_answer_pairs.question: How does the circular state that the police verification should be carried out?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that the police verification should be carried out in respect of the drivers and helpers etc. of buses/vans/auto-rickshaw ferrying school children.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason mentioned for repeating the police verification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that the police verification is to be repeated after every two years, as the person may be affected by many psycho-social factors in his immediate or distant environment.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Regional Offices should not take up issues of any project proponent with various Statutory Authorities directly

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number and date of this vacancy circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document number is No. 47/5/2020-R&R and the date is 5th January, 2022.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry issued this vacancy circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Power, Government of India issued this vacancy circular.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name and designation of the signatories of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is signed by Shram Shakti Bhavan, Rafi Marg, New Delhi.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the position being advertised in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The position being advertised is the Chairperson of the Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission (JERC) for Goa & UTs.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is the JERC for Goa & UTs located?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The JERC for Goa & UTs is located at Gurgaon (Haryana).

question_answer_pairs.question: How many members are there in the JERC for Goa & UTs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The JERC for Goa & UTs consists of a Chairperson and another Member.

question_answer_pairs.question: When did the post of Chairperson in the JERC for Goa & UTs fall vacant?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The post of Chairperson in the JERC for Goa & UTs fell vacant on 17.9.2021.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the qualifications required for the post of Chairperson in the JERC for Goa & UTs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The qualifications are prescribed in Section 84 (1) of the Electricity Act.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the tenure of the Chairperson of the JERC for Goa & UTs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Chairperson of JERC for Goa & UTs shall hold office for a term of five years from the date on which he/she enters upon his/her office or till he/she attains the age of sixty-five years, whichever is earlier.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process for appointment of the Chairperson of the JERC for Goa & UTs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Appointment to the post of Chairperson, JERC for Goa & UTs is governed by the relevant provisions of the Electricity Act and the Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission for Union Territories except Delhi (Salary, Allowances and other Conditions of Service of Chairperson and Member) Rules, 2007 & Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission for Union Territories except Delhi (Salary, Allowances and other Conditions of Service of Chairperson and Members) Amendment Rules, 2021.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the relevant extracts of the Electricity Act, 2003 attached with this vacancy circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The relevant extracts of the Electricity Act, 2003 relating to the requirement of qualification, experience, etc. for Member, JERC for Goa & UTs and a copy of Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission (Salary, Allowances and other Conditions of Service of Chairperson and Members) Rules, 2007 & Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission for Union Territories except Delhi (Salary, Allowances and other Conditions of Service of Chairperson and Members) Amendment Rules, 2021 are attached with the vacancy circular.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where can one find the website of the Ministry of Power to access this vacancy circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The website of the Ministry of Power i.e. www.powermin.nic.in is mentioned in the circular where the vacancy circular is posted.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of setting up the JERC for Goa & UTs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The JERC for Goa & UTs was set up by the Government of India under the provisions of the Electricity Act, 2003 to regulate the electricity sector in Goa and the Union Territories.

question_answer_pairs.question: How many members are there in the JERC for Goa & UTs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The JERC for Goa & UTs consists of a Chairperson and another Member.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Chairperson in the JERC for Goa & UTs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Chairperson of JERC for Goa & UTs shall hold office and perform the functions of the Commission.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the age limit for the Chairperson of the JERC for Goa & UTs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The candidate will have to give a declaration that he/she does not have any financial or other interest, which is likely to affect prejudicially his/her function as Chairperson of the JERC.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the salary and allowances for the Chairperson of the JERC for Goa & UTs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The salary, allowances and other conditions of service of the Chairperson are governed by the Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission (Salary, Allowances and other Conditions of Service of Chairperson and Members) Rules, 2007 & Joint Electricity Regulatory Commission for Union Territories except Delhi (Salary, Allowances and other Conditions of Service of Chairperson and Members) Amendment Rules, 2021.

question_answer_pairs.question: How can one access the rules governing the salary and allowances of the Chairperson of the JERC for Goa & UTs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The relevant rules are attached with the vacancy circular and can also be accessed on the website of the Ministry of Power i.e. www.powermin.nic.in.

question_answer_pairs.answer: Production in RCF is required to be commenced on a crash nucleus of a trained and experienced railway staff.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the incentives that may be offered to employees selected for transfer to the new Coach Factory?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (i) (a) Staff in Group C & D drafted from other zonal railways/Production Units may be considered for out of turn promotion (if found fit) grades higher than the grade held by them on a regular basis in their parent cadre; or (b) Staff in Group C & D drafted for this project may be sanctioned out of turn promotion (if found fit) to the grade then the grade held by them on a regular basis in their parent cadre; or (c) Staff in Groups C & D drafted for this project may be sanctioned a maximum of five advance increments in the present time scale, subject to their pay in the promotion grade not exceeding the maximum of that grade; or (d) Staff in Groups C & D drafted from Zonal Railways and Production Units will be entitled to opt for the incentives mentioned above in sub paras (a), (b) & (c).

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maximum number of advance increments that can be sanctioned to staff in Groups C & D drafted for this project?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A maximum of five advance increments.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maximum number of advance increments that can be sanctioned to Officers posted to the project from other Zonal Railways/Production Units?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Three advance increments in the time scale.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maximum grade up to which officers posted to the project from other Zonal Railways/Production Units may be sanctioned?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Upto and inclusive of Jr. grade.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To fill up the post of Joint Advisor in TRAI HQ, New Delhi on deputation on foreign service terms.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the duration of the deputation on foreign service terms?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The deputation is for a period of three years.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the required qualifications and experience for the post of Joint Advisor?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A Master's / Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration / Economics / Commerce / Engineering / Law / Science / Humanities from a recognized University / Institute and possessing requisite experience in the relevant field.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the pay level and scale of pay for the post of Joint Advisor?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Pay Level-13 with a pay scale of Rs. 123100-215900/-.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are eligible to apply for the post of Joint Advisor?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Officers of the Central Government, Public Sector Undertakings and Statutory and Autonomous Bodies holding equivalent post on regular basis.

question_answer_pairs.answer: A Master's / Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration / Economics / Commerce / Engineering / Law / Science / Humanities from a recognized University / Institute.

question_answer_pairs.answer: Possessing requisite experience in the relevant field.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the eligibility criteria for 'Group A' Officers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Group 'A' Officers having twelve years of regular service in the Government of India, out of which at least five years of regular service shall be in the JAG.

question_answer_pairs.answer: Officers in Junior Administrative Grade with five years of regular service in that grade OR.

question_answer_pairs.answer: Officers in DA, HRA etc. as per Govt. Rules.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The functions relating to regulation of Broadcasting and Cable Services Sectors have also been entrusted to TRAI from 2004.

question_answer_pairs.answer: TRAI has been established under an Act of Parliament viz. the TRAI Act, 1997.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Diversion of funds from core business to other activities - reg.

question_answer_pairs.question: What has been brought to the knowledge of the Department?
question_answer_pairs.answer: That some of the multi-state cooperative societies are diverting their funds from core business to other activities which is not as per the by-laws approved by the MSCS Act, 2002.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the multi-state cooperative societies hereby directed to do?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Invest its funds as per the provisions of the MSCS Act, 2002 read with by-laws approved by the Central Registrar in this regard.

question_answer_pairs.question: What will happen in case of any diversion of funds from core business to other activities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Severe action will be taken against the societies including winding up as per the provisions of the MSCS Act, 2002.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Transfer of female employees in Public Sector Banks - minimizing their hardship.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the letter addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Chairman, SBI/CMDs of all Public Sector Banks including IDBI and SBI Associates.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which government department issued this letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Department of Financial Services, Ministry of Finance, Government of India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: August 8, 2014.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is the letter sent from?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Jeevan Deep, IIIrd Floor, Parliament Street, New Delhi.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To accommodate as far as possible the placement/transfer of married female employees and unmarried female employees near their husband's or parents' place, respectively.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for the transfer policy mentioned in the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To address the genuine hardship faced by female employees transferred away from their husband or parents.

question_answer_pairs.question: How does the letter instruct PSBs to address the issue?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To frame a policy on the subject with the approval of their Board.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the approval required for this policy?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Approval of Secretary (Financial Services).

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the line of confirmation mentioned in the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To be sent to the Department immediately after adoption of the policy by the Board of the Bank.

question_answer_pairs.answer: Manish Kumar, Under Secretary to the Government of India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document number is R-11017/10/2013-L&M (Pt.).

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is issued by the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers' Welfare, Department of Agriculture, Cooperation and Farmers' Welfare.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is the office of the Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies located?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The office is located in Krishi Bhawan, New Delhi.

question_answer_pairs.question: When was this circular dated?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is dated 17th August, 2016.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is about certain cooperative societies depicting themselves as multi-state cooperative societies by claiming extension of their area of operation to other States/UTs without any registration from the Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies.

question_answer_pairs.question: According to the circular, under which section of the State Cooperative Societies Act, 2002 can a State Cooperative Society be converted into a multi-state cooperative society?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular mentions that a State Cooperative Society can be converted into a multi-state cooperative society under section 22 of the State Cooperative Societies Act, 2002.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Registrar of Cooperative Societies (RCS) of the concerned States/UTs in this matter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that the society proposes to extend their area of operation are required to be examined and registered by the RCS of the concerned States/UTs.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the action that the States/UTs may take if any State cooperative society is found depicting itself as a multi-state cooperative society?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that the States/UTs may take note of the above and if any State cooperative society is found depicting itself as a multi-state cooperative society, strict legal action may be taken against them.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has signed this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is signed by Ashish Kumar Bhutani, the Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies and Joint Secretary to the Government of India.

question_answer_pairs.question: To whom is this circular distributed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is distributed to the Chief Secretary of all States/UTs, Principal Secretary (Cooperation) of all States/UTs, and Registrar of Cooperative Societies of all States/UTs.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this letter is to invite nominations of officers for appointment on deputation to posts under the Central Staffing Scheme for the year 2014.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the rank of the officers being nominated under the Central Staffing Scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter states that the Central Staffing Scheme is for the rank of Joint Secretary and above, and the remaining 70% of the posts are at the level of Director/Deputy Secretary.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the process for appointing officers under the Central Staffing Scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter mentions that considerable process and exercise are gone through before an officer is appointed under the Central Staffing Scheme.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the policy regarding officers appointed under the Central Staffing Scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter states that officers appointed under the Central Staffing Scheme are not to be debarred from being taken on deputation to a post under the Central Staffing Scheme for a period of five years.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the instruction regarding the offer list for the Central Staffing Scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter requests that the guidelines for nominating suitable officers are strictly adhered to while drawing up the offer list.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the percentage of posts under the Central Staffing Scheme that are at the level of Director/Deputy Secretary?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter states that 70% of the posts under the Central Staffing Scheme are at the level of Director/Deputy Secretary.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the rank of the officers at the top level of the Central Staffing Scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter mentions that the Central Staffing Scheme is for the rank of Joint Secretary and above.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter states that an officer who is debarred from being taken on deputation to a post under the Central Staffing Scheme is also to be debarred from being given Cadre Clearance for foreign assignments/consultancies abroad during the period of debarment.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter states that it is difficult to forecast placements in advance, and if an officer is placed on the offer list, his name is not withdrawn during this period, save under exceptional circumstances.

question_answer_pairs.question: Under which section of the University Grants Commission (UGC) Act, 1956 is the Central Government empowered to declare an institution as a deemed-to-be-university?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government is empowered under Section 3 of the University Grants Commission (UGC) Act, 1956 to declare an institution as a deemed-to-be-university.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which eight multi-campuses were declared as 'Institution Deemed to be University' in 2002?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The eight multi-campuses located at Lucknow, Allahabad, Jaipur, Srinagar, Pune, Jammu & Garhwal (Kangra, Himachal Pradesh) were declared as 'Institution Deemed to be University' in 2002.

question_answer_pairs.question: For how many years was the status of Deemed to be University extended for Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The status of Deemed to be University was extended for Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi for a further period of five years up to 06.05.2012.

question_answer_pairs.question: What did the Central Government permit Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi to do in 2009?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government permitted Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi to bring the Bhopal and Mumbai Campus under its ambit as constituent teaching units.

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the status of Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi extended from 07
question_answer_pairs.answer: The status of Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi was extended from 07.05.2012 onwards.

question_answer_pairs.question: What application did Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi submit to the UGC?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi submitted an application for starting of an Off-Campus Centre at Agartala, Tripura.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who examined the application forwarded by UGC for examination and advice?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The UGC examined the application with the help of its Expert Committee.

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the recommendation of the Expert Committee's report considered by the Commission?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The report of Expert Committee was considered by the Commission in its 503rd meeting held on 22.09.2014 and recommended for approval the proposal for establishing of Off-Campus centre of Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan at Agartala, Tripura.

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the approval for the establishment of the Off-Campus centre of Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan at Agartala, Tripura conveyed to Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi by this Ministry?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The approval for the establishment of the Off-Campus centre of Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan at Agartala, Tripura was conveyed to Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi by this Ministry on 5th December, 2016.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of UGC mentioned in the notification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: UGC stands for University Grants Commission.

question_answer_pairs.question: On whose advice did the Central Government declare the eight multi-campuses as 'Institution Deemed to be University' in 2002?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government declared the eight multi-campuses as 'Institution Deemed to be University' in 2002 on the advice of the UGC.

question_answer_pairs.question: When did the Central Government, on the advice of the UGC, extend the status of Deemed to be University to Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government, on the advice of the UGC, extended the status of Deemed to be University to Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi up to 06.05.2012.

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the date of the UGC's Notification No
question_answer_pairs.answer: The date of the UGC's Notification No. 9-28/2000-U.3 that permitted Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi to bring the Bhopal and Mumbai Campus under its ambit was 30.06.2009.

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the date of the UGC's Notification No
question_answer_pairs.answer: The date of the UGC's Notification No. 9-28/2000-U.3(Pt.1) that extended the status of Deemed to be University of Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi from 07.05.2012 onwards was 13th February, 2019.

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the name of the Off-Campus Centre that Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi submitted an application for starting?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi submitted an application for starting of an Off-Campus Centre at Agartala, Tripura.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who helped the UGC in examining the application forwarded by Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The UGC examined the application with the help of its Expert Committee.

question_answer_pairs.question: On what date was the report of the Expert Committee considered by the Commission in its 503rd meeting?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The report of Expert Committee was considered by the Commission in its 503rd meeting held on 22.09.2014.

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the recommendation of the Commission based on the Expert Committee's report?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Commission recommended for approval the proposal for establishing of Off-Campus centre of Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan at Agartala, Tripura.

question_answer_pairs.question: On what date was the approval for the establishment of the Off-Campus centre conveyed to Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi by the Ministry?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The approval for the establishment of the Off-Campus centre was conveyed to Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi by this Ministry on 5th December, 2016.

question_answer_pairs.question: How many multi-campuses were declared as 'Institution Deemed to be University' in 2002?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Eight multi-campuses were declared as 'Institution Deemed to be University' in 2002.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which cities were the eight multi-campuses located in that were declared as 'Institution Deemed to be University' in 2002?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The eight multi-campuses were located at Lucknow, Allahabad, Jaipur, Srinagar, Pune, Jammu & Garhwal (Kangra, Himachal Pradesh).

question_answer_pairs.question: For how many years was the status of Deemed to be University extended for Rashtriya Sanskrit Sansthan, New Delhi in 2012?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To inform about the applicability of Oil Cess levy to the types of oils and that the Oil Cess shall be payable by the ship owners or their agent or Master prior to the discharge of cargo at any Indian port or ports.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which types of oils are subject to the Oil Cess levy?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All types of oils, except the non-persistent oil carried by the oil tanker in bulk as cargo.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are directed to collect the Oil Cess?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All Dy. Port Conservators of major Indian ports, State Port Officers of Maritime Boards and Port Officers of minor / captive ports.

question_answer_pairs.question: Under which provisions are the Oil Cess to be collected?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Under the provisions of MARPOL 73/78 Annex. I Regulation 1 (1) and Regulation 12 (2)(a) to (f).

question_answer_pairs.answer: The ship owners or their agent or Master.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the designated maritime administration for the shipping industry in India?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Directorate General of Shipping (DGS), Ministry of Shipping (MOS), Govt. of India

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the DGS, GOI?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It is the designated maritime administration for the shipping industry & its allied sectors in India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What services does the DGS, GOI provide?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It provides multiple services, including inter-alia, registration, survey, inspection, certification, approval, license & sanction.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the recipients of the operational services of the DGS, GOI?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Various stakeholders in these sectors are the recipients of the operational services of the DGS, GOI.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the mandated functions of the Directorate General of Shipping?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Directorate declares its mandated functions, under the provisions of various statutes, inter-alia, the Merchant Shipping [M.S.] Act, 1958.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the Rules framed there-under and in accordance with the various international maritime Conventions and Codes?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Rules framed there-under and in accordance with the various international maritime Conventions and Codes.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the contemporary era for the shipping industry?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The contemporaneous era of a globalised & competitive business & techno-financial environment for the shipping industry.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the need for the DGS to re-orient itself?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There is a critical & imperative need for the DGS to re-orient itself to render such public services better, faster and with utmost transparency, more than even before, to stay relevant, responsible & responsive to the rising aspirations of the industry.

question_answer_pairs.question: What cannot be over-emphasized in this context?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The need to re-engineer the business processes & procedures of the Directorate General of Shipping, GOI and its allied field offices, i.e. the Mercantile Marine Departments [MMDs], etc.

question_answer_pairs.question: Under which act is the Central Government empowered to declare an institution as a University?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government is empowered under Section 3 of the University Grants Commission (UGC) Act, 1956 to declare an institution as a University.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the UGC notification that declared the four institutions as Deemed to be Universities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Central Government, on the advice of the UGC, had declared the four institutions as Deemed to be Universities under Section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956 subject to a review after five years, as per Notification No. 9-46/2004-U.3 dated 17th January, 2007.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which four institutions were declared as Deemed to be Universities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The four institutions declared as Deemed to be Universities are: K.M. Shah Dental College and Hospital, K.J. Pandya College of Physiotherapy, S.B.K.S. Medical Institute and Research Centre, and Sumandeep Nursing College.

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the purpose of the UGC Expert Committee's examination of the Sumandeep Vidyapeeth, Vadodara (Gujarat)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The UGC constituted an Expert Committee to examine the performance and academic outcomes of the Sumandeep Vidyapeeth, Vadodara (Gujarat).

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the recommendation of the UGC Expert Committee regarding the Sumandeep Vidyapeeth, Vadodara (Gujarat)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The UGC Expert Committee in its report gave the very good grade to Sumandeep Vidyapeeth, Vadodara (Gujarat) on its academic performance and recommended for continuation of their Deemed to be University status.

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the report of the UGC Expert Committee considered by the Commission?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The report of the UGC Expert Committee was considered by the Commission in its 544th meeting (Item No.2.12) held on 16.10.2019.

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the decision taken by the Commission based on the UGC Expert Committee's report?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Commission resolved to continue/extend the Deemed to be University status for those Institutions who were rated Excellent, Very Good & Good for academic performance by the Expert Committee. However, those Deemed to be Universities which were rated poor and average for academic performance will not be granted continuation/extension.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Retention of Railway accommodation by staff of Railway Audit Department in the event of transfer from one place to another necessitating change of residence.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry issued this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Railways, Government of India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number?
When was this document issued?
Who are the intended recipients of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The General Managers, All Indian Railways/PUs and others.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for issuing this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To provide instructions governing the retention of Railway accommodation by staff of Railway Audit Department in the event of transfer from one place to another necessitating change of residence.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the key decision mentioned in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: That since the staff of Railway Audit Department also encounter the same difficulties of dislocation on transfer from one place to another and have to apply to the same Controlling Authorities for allotment of Railway accommodation, the similar facilities for retention of Railway accommodation in the event of transfer necessitating change of residence as extended to Railway employees as per para 1 of Board's letter No. E(G)2000 QR1-23 dated 1/6/2001 may be deemed to be part of the instructions from that date.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision added as item (d) under para 1 of Board's letter No
question_answer_pairs.answer: That these instructions will also be applicable to the employees of Railway Audit Department in allotment and occupation of Railway accommodation.

question_answer_pairs.question: To whom will the further instructions issued from time to time pertaining to the retention of Railway accommodation by Railway employees in the event of posting to new Zones/Divisions also be applicable?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The employees of Railway Audit Department.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number and date of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document number is No. Z-28016/24/2014-SSH and the date is May, 2015.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Health & Family Welfare (MMSSY Division) issued this circular.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is Reconstitution of Selection Committees for filling up Faculty/Non-Faculty/Resident/Contractual Posts in New AIIMS.

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the ministry been receiving references about?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The ministry has been receiving references from the new AIIMS for filling up various positions in Faculty/Non Faculty, Engagement of Residents as well as Contractual appointments.

question_answer_pairs.question: What has been decided by the competent authority regarding the new AIIMS?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It has been decided that the new AIIMS would require to be armed with certain delegated powers, streamlining of procedures, so as to bring about an effective turnaround in building up human resources.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the ministry's view on the functional requirements for expeditious recruitment?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The ministry, after careful consideration, has specified the need for expeditious recruitment and the procedural and other aspects reflected in relevant provisions under the AIIMS Act 1956.

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the ministry set out to do regarding the consolidation of the various Institutions/Guidelines/Orders regulating the recruitment in various posts?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The ministry has set out to bring about consolidation of the various Institutions/Guidelines/Orders regulating the recruitment in various posts.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will be the Selection Committee for regular appointment to faculty posts in the new AIIMS?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Standing Selection Committee (SSC) of the respective new AIIMS as notified vide Ministry Order No. Z-28016/42/2013 dated 17th February, 2014 will be the Selection Committee.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the 'Standing Selection Committee' mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The 'Standing Selection Committee', in pursuance to the decision taken in the last meeting of the Institute Body(ies) of the six New All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) thereby authorising the President (Hon'ble Health & Family Welfare Minister) to constitute, inter alia the Standing Selection Committee as per relevant provisions of the AIIMS Act 1956.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is the Nirman Bhawan, Maulana Azad Road located?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Nirman Bhawan, Maulana Azad Road is located in New Delhi-110011.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The date mentioned in the circular is May, 2015.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this circular is to provide information regarding the reconstitution of Selection Committees for filling up Faculty/Non-Faculty/Resident/Contractual Posts in New AIIMS.

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the ministry been considering regarding the above issues?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The above issues have been in consideration of the Ministry for some time now, in the light of the circulars issued on 4th April 2013, 6th August 2013 and 18th July 2014.

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the ministry decided regarding the new AIIMS and their powers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The ministry has decided that the new AIIMS would require to be armed with certain delegated powers, streamlining of procedures, so as to bring about an effective turnaround in building up human resources.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the relevant provisions under the AIIMS Act 1956 that the ministry has referred to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The ministry has referred to the relevant provisions under the AIIMS Act 1956, read with the AIIMS (Amendment) Act 2012, the AIIMS Rules 1999 and AIIMS Regulation 1999 as applicable.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Standing Selection Committee mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Standing Selection Committee is for the selection of Faculty posts to be filled on a regular basis in the six new AIIMS.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will constitute the Standing Selection Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Standing Selection Committee will be constituted by the President (Hon'ble Health & Family Welfare Minister) as per relevant provisions of the AIIMS Act 1956.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the Ministry Order mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry Order No. Z-28016/42/2013 is dated 17th February, 2014.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the consolidation of the various Institutions/Guidelines/Orders mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the consolidation is to regulate the recruitment in various posts in the new AIIMS.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the various positions mentioned in the circular for which the Selection Committees are being reconstituted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The positions mentioned are Faculty/Non-Faculty/Resident/Contractual Posts in New AIIMS.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date from which the ministry has been receiving references from the new AIIMS?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The ministry has been receiving references from the new AIIMS for some time now.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the streamlining of procedures mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The streamlining of procedures is to bring about an effective turnaround in building up human resources for the new AIIMS.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the relevant provisions of the AIIMS Act 1956 that the ministry has referred to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The ministry has referred to the relevant provisions under the AIIMS Act 1956, read with the AIIMS (Amendment) Act 2012, the AIIMS Rules 1999 and AIIMS Regulation 1999.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Standing Selection Committee mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Standing Selection Committee is for the selection of Faculty posts to be filled on a regular basis in the six new AIIMS.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the decision taken by the Institute Body(ies) of the six New AIIMS regarding the Standing Selection Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Institute Body(ies) of the six New AIIMS have authorized the President (Hon'ble Health & Family Welfare Minister) to constitute the Standing Selection Committee.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The date of the last meeting of the Institute Body(ies) is not specified in the circular.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the various posts mentioned in the circular for which the Selection Committees are being reconstituted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The posts mentioned are Faculty/Non-Faculty/Resident/Contractual Posts in New AIIMS.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to regulate the recruitment in various posts, as detailed below.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The ministry has been considering the above issues for some time now, in the light of the circulars issued on 4th April 2013, 6th August 2013 and 18th July 2014.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the title of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Circular No.141/11/2020-GST

question_answer_pairs.question: What government agency issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Government of India, Ministry of Finance, Department of Revenue, Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs, GST Policy Wing

question_answer_pairs.question: When was this circular issued?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular was issued on the 24th June, 2020.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the circular addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Principal Chief Commissioners / Chief Commissioners / Principal Commissioners / Commissioners of Central Tax (All) and The Principal Director Generals / Director Generals (All)

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Clarification in respect of various measures announced by the Government for providing relief to the taxpayers in view of spread of Novel Corona Virus (COVID-19)

question_answer_pairs.question: Which previous circular is this circular referring to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Circular No. 136/06/2020-GST, dated 03.04.2020

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the purpose of the previous circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The previous circular was issued by the Board on the subject issue clarifying various issues relating to the measures announced by the Government providing relief to the taxpayers.

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the purpose of the 40th meeting of the GST Council held on 12.06.2020?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The 40th meeting of the GST Council held on 12.06.2020 recommended further relief to the taxpayers and accordingly, following notifications have been issued.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the notification number and date of the first notification mentioned in the table?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Notification No.51/2020-Central Tax, dated 24.06.2020

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of Notification No.51/2020-Central Tax?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Notification No.51/2020-Central Tax seeks to provide relief to taxpayers by reducing the rate of interest from 18% per annum to 9% per annum for specified period.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the notification number and date of the second notification mentioned in the table?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Notification No.52/2020-Central Tax, dated 24.06.2020

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of Notification No.52/2020-Central Tax?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Notification No.52/2020-Central Tax seeks to provide relief to taxpayers by conditional waiver of late fee for delay in furnishing FORM GSTR-3B for specified period.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the notification number and date of the third notification mentioned in the table?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Notification No.53/2020-Central Tax, dated 24.06.2020

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of Notification No.53/2020-Central Tax?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Notification No.53/2020-Central Tax seeks to provide relief to taxpayers by conditional waiver of late fee for delay in furnishing FORM GSTR-1 for specified period.

question_answer_pairs.question: How have the above referred notifications amended the parent notifications?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The above referred notifications have amended the parent notifications through which the relief from interest for late payment of GST and late fee for delay in furnishing of FORM GSTR-3B / FORM GSTR-1 was provided for the tax periods of February, March and April, 2020.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the clarifications issued vide Circular No.136/06/2020-GST?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The clarifications issued vide Circular No. 136/06/2020-GST, dated 03.04.2020 were to incorporate the decisions of the 40th meeting of the GST Council in order to ensure uniformity in the implementation of the provisions of the law across the field formations.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: AICTE Guidelines for inclusive education for all including persons with disabilities.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which policy emphasizes equal opportunity for education for all, irrespective of caste, gender and abilities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The National Education Policy (NEP) 2020.

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the NEP 2020 accelerated the need for?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The creation of an 'inclusive education' system that caters to students with both visible and invisible disabilities.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the 'Equal Opportunity Facilitation Cell (EOFC)'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To facilitate inclusive digital education for all, including Persons with Disabilities.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will be the members of the EOFC?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Senior faculty, Male/Female faculty, Male/Female Non-Teaching staff, Male/Female student, Representative of NGO working in the area of Empowerment of PWDs, and Registrar/Admin officer.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the roles and responsibilities of the EOFC?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is 'Mapping of Gram Panchayat and Planning for BCA/CSCs for Direct Benefit Transfer-Sub Service Area Approach-Partial Amendment of guidelines-regarding.'

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to provide guidelines regarding the coverage of villages under the Financial Inclusion Plan whose population is below 2000.

question_answer_pairs.question: What was required to be done as per the letter of even No
question_answer_pairs.answer: As per the letter, Sub Service Area (SSA) was to be carved out through mapping of Gram Panchayats and such SSAs are to be allotted to banks for providing at least one banking facility (Branch/BCA).

question_answer_pairs.question: What did RBI issue in terms of Monetary Policy Statement 2012-13?
question_answer_pairs.answer: RBI had issued guidelines for preparing a roadmap covering all unbanked villages of population less than 2000 for providing banking services in a time bound manner.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for banks as per the RBI guidelines?
question_answer_pairs.answer: As per the guidelines, banks should endeavor to have a Business Correspondent (BC) touch point in each village, to start with, at least once a fortnight.

question_answer_pairs.question: What have some banks pointed out regarding the guidelines of the government and RBI?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Some banks have pointed out that there is a divergence between the guidelines of the Government and RBI.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the relationship between the RBI and government guidelines according to the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In fact, there is no divergence between RBI and Government guidelines. If read together, the Government guidelines stipulate a stationary Business Correspondent Agent (BCA) in an SSA who can also cater to the needs of the nearby villages by fixing certain days in a week/fortnight to visit all other villages in the SSA.

question_answer_pairs.question: How do the two guidelines supplement each other?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The two guidelines supplement each other, with the RBI guidelines providing for a roadmap for unbanked villages and the Government guidelines providing for a stationary BCA in the SSA who can also visit other nearby villages.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the stationary BCA in the SSA as per the government guidelines?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The stationary BCA in the SSA can also cater to the needs of the nearby villages by fixing certain days in a week/fortnight to visit all other villages in the SSA.

question_answer_pairs.question: How often is the stationary BCA required to visit the other villages in the SSA?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The stationary BCA is required to visit all other villages in the SSA on certain fixed days in a week/fortnight.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the overall purpose of the mapping of Gram Panchayats and planning for BCA/CSCs?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The overall purpose is for Direct Benefit Transfer-Sub Service Area Approach.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the population criteria for the villages covered under the Financial Inclusion Plan as per this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The villages covered under the Financial Inclusion Plan have a population below 2000.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which government ministry issued this letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Health & Family Welfare (PMSSY Division) issued this letter.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the letter addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The letter is addressed to the Director AIIMS Bhopal, the Director AIIMS Bhubaneshwar, the Director AIIMS Jodhpur, the Director AIIMS Patna, the Director AIIMS Raipur, and the Director AIIMS Rishikesh.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is Clarification regarding payment of RA Bills etc.

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the purpose of the meeting convened by the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The meeting was convened to review the progress of the payment of RA Bills, etc.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who attended the meeting?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A meeting of all the Financial Advisors (FA) and Superintendent Engineers (S.E.s) of the six AIIMS (Bhopal, Bhubaneshwar, Jodhpur, Patna, Raipur, Rishikesh) was convened.

question_answer_pairs.question: What was explained to the Superintendent Engineers (S
question_answer_pairs.answer: The respective AIIMS has been authorized to make payments against all Running Account (RA) Bills and of Project Fund vide this office letter.

question_answer_pairs.question: When were the RA Bills to be processed and paid?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All Running Accounts Bills (RA Bills) are to be processed and paid at the respective site of the six new AIIMS pertaining to the Financial Year 2014-15 (if any pending) and 2015-16 onward.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is to be processed and paid at the respective site of the six new AIIMS pertaining to the Financial Year 2014-15 and 2015-16 onwards?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the verification survey?

question_answer_pairs.question: What opportunity does the candidate who is declared failed have, according to the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The candidate who is declared failed has an opportunity to request for re-evaluation of his written and oral examination on payment of the prescribed fee.

question_answer_pairs.question: Within what period should the candidate submit the request for re-evaluation?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the final status of the re-evaluation results?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The results of the re-evaluation of examination shall be final and no further appeal for re-evaluation shall be entertained.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is Discussion on Section 64 of the Multi State Cooperative Societies Act, 2002-reg.

question_answer_pairs.question: When is the meeting scheduled to be held?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The meeting is scheduled to be held on 07th April, 2017 at 11:00 A.M.

question_answer_pairs.question: Under whose chairmanship is the meeting being convened?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The meeting is being convened under the Chairmanship of Joint Secretary (Cooperation) / Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where will the meeting be held?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The meeting will be held in room no. 142 at Krishi Bhawan, Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers' Welfare, Department of Agriculture, Cooperation & Farmers' Welfare, New Delhi.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the meeting?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the meeting is to discuss the provisions of Section 64 of the MSCS Act, 2002.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the addressees requested to attend the meeting?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The addressees are requested to attend the meeting.

question_answer_pairs.question: What information are the addressees requested to provide?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The addressees are requested to confirm their participation along with their contact details by email at kamna.sachdeva@gov.in latest by 04th April, 2017.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first issue that will be discussed in the meeting?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The first issue that will be discussed is the kind of amendments required in Section 64 of the MSCS Act, 2002 with reasons.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the second issue that will be discussed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The second issue is sub-section (c) of Section 64 of the MSCS Act, 2002, which is about investment of funds in shares or securities of any other multi-state cooperative society or any co-operative society. Extent of cap or ceiling on such kind of investment.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the third issue that will be discussed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The third issue is sub-section (e) of Section 64 of the MSCS Act, 2002, which is about investment of funds in shares or securities of a subsidiary institution or any other institution. Extent of cap or ceiling on such kind of investment.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the fourth issue that will be discussed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The fourth issue is the kind of risk mitigation measures being adopted by the multi-state cooperative societies/banks while investing their funds/deposits.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the fifth issue that will be discussed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The fifth issue is the various measures adopted by the multi-state cooperative societies/banks to diversify the investment portfolio with minimum risk.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the sixth issue that will be discussed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The sixth issue is the safeguards adopted to protect the depositors' money.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Second Mehar Baba Competition (MBC-II).

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has organized the Mehar Baba Competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Indian Air Force Ministry of defence.

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the first edition of the Mehar Baba Competition held?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The first edition of the Mehar Baba Competition (MBC-I) was held on 06 Apr 2022.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the aim of the MBC-II competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The competition aims to stimulate the development of indigenous industries in the field of Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS) and finding an innovative solution to detect Foreign Object Debris on aircraft surfaces.

question_answer_pairs.question: In how many phases will the competition be conducted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The competition will be conducted in four phases.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first phase of the competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Phase-O involves registration of all participants and short-listing of approximately 30 participants based on the analysis of their proposals.

question_answer_pairs.question: What will happen in the second phase of the competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In the second phase, the 30 selected participants will have a detailed presentation of their proposals.

question_answer_pairs.question: What will happen in the third phase of the competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In the third phase, 10 participants will be selected for continuing to the next phase: Phase-3 involving practical demonstration of prototype.

question_answer_pairs.question: What will happen in the fourth phase of the competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In the fourth phase, the 10 selected participants in Phase-3 (Final Phase) will have demonstration of the complete concept as envisaged by IAF.

question_answer_pairs.question: When will the winners of the competition be announced?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The winners will be announced tentatively on 06 October 2023 (Air Force Day).

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the total prize money for the competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Indian Air Force intends to disburse upto Rs. 13 Crores as R&D funds, award the winners a prize of Rs. 60 Lakhs.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the last date for submitting entries for the competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Entries have to be submitted by 02 October 2022.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where can further details about the competition be obtained?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Further details can be obtained by registering on the IAF webpage www.indianairforce.nic.in/mhcb.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who can be contacted for any further clarification and answers to queries regarding the competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Manoj Kumar, Project Officer, MBC-II on +91-9412727033 or Group Captain Deepak Chaudhary, Director Operations (MPC & RPA) on 011-23063703 (office) from Monday to Friday email-id: mhcb2022@gmail.com.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of UAS mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: UAS stands for Unmanned Aerial Systems.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of FOD mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: FOD stands for Foreign Object Debris.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of IAF mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: IAF stands for Indian Air Force.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of MBC-I and MBC-II mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: MBC-I and MBC-II stand for Mehar Baba Competition-I and Mehar Baba Competition-II respectively.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of AICTE mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: AICTE stands for All India Council for Technical Education.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of R&D mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: R&D stands for Research and Development.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the address of the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The address is Nelson Mandela Marg, Vasant Kunj, New Delhi-110070.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the website of the All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE) mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The website is www.aicte-india.org.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The phone number is 011-29581000, 78, 86.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the email-id mentioned in the circular for any further clarification and answers to queries regarding the competition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The email-id is mhcb2022@gmail.com.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Late Air Commodore Mehar Singh in whose honor the competition is organized?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Late Air Commodore Mehar Singh was an Indian Air Force officer.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the objective of the Mehar Baba Competition (MBC-II)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The objective is to stimulate the development of indigenous industries in the field of Unmanned Aerial Systems (UAS) and finding an innovative solution to detect Foreign Object Debris on aircraft surfaces.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the total prize money for the winners of the Mehar Baba Competition (MBC-II)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The total prize money is up to Rs. 13 Crores as R&D funds, and the winners will be awarded a prize of Rs. 60 Lakhs.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the theme of the Mehar Baba Competition (MBC-II)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The theme is 'Swarm Drone Based Foreign Object Detection on Aircraft Surfaces'.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who can participate in the Mehar Baba Competition (MBC-II)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All Directors/Principals of AICTE Approved Institutions and All Vice Chancellors of Technical Universities can participate.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The percentage of service tax payable by the service provider is Nil.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The recipient of the service is Any person located in the taxable territory other than non-assessee online recipient (Business Recipient).

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the recipient of the services provided or agreed to be provided by a goods transport agency (GTA) in respect of transportation of goods by road?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The recipient of the service is (a) any factory registered under or governed by the Factories Act, 1948; (b) any society registered under the Societies Registration Act, 1860 or under any other law for the time being in force.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is a letter from the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change informing the Ministry of Civil Aviation (MoCA) / Airport Authority of India (AAI) about the Environment Impact Assessment (EIA) Notification 2006 and its requirements for construction of new projects or modernization of existing projects.

question_answer_pairs.question: What projects have the Ministry of Civil Aviation (MoCA) / Airport Authority of India (AAI) undertaken?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Civil Aviation (MoCA) / Airport Authority of India (AAI) have undertaken several projects for improving regional connectivity through building new runways and airports, along with expanding many existing airports and their associated facilities.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the exemptions mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document states that 'Air strips which do not involve bunkering/refuelling facility and or Air Traffic Control, are exempted' from the Environment Clearance (EC) requirements.

question_answer_pairs.question: What measures has this Ministry taken in the last few years?
question_answer_pairs.answer: In the last few years, this Ministry has taken several measures for streamlining the system to ensure expeditious appraisal and timely grant of Environment Clearances. These measures include online submission and processing of proposals, standard Terms of Reference (ToR) for expansion projects, and online data collection etc.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the website mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The website mentioned in the document is https://parivesh.nic.in, which is the Ministry's portal for grant of EC.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the signatory of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is signed by Leena Nandan, the Secretary of the Ministry of Environment, Forest and Climate Change.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the addressee of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is addressed to Shri Rajiv Bansal, the Secretary of the Ministry of Civil Aviation.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is the Rajiv Gandhi Bhawan located?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Rajiv Gandhi Bhawan is located at Safdarjung Airport Area, New Delhi-110003.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Environment Impact Assessment (EIA) Notification 2006?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The EIA Notification 2006 mandates prior Environment Clearance (EC) for construction of new projects or modernization of existing projects.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the measures taken by this Ministry to streamline the system for Environment Clearances?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry has taken several measures to streamline the system, including online submission and processing of proposals, standard Terms of Reference (ToR) for expansion projects, and online data collection.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the letter?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the letter is to inform the Ministry of Civil Aviation (MoCA) / Airport Authority of India (AAI) about the requirements of the EIA Notification 2006 and the exemptions for certain types of projects.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the exemptions provided in the EIA Notification 2006?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The EIA Notification 2006 exempts 'Air strips which do not involve bunkering/refuelling facility and or Air Traffic Control' from the requirement of obtaining Environment Clearance.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Impact Assessment (IA) Division of the Ministry would coordinate and ensure further guidance to the concerned officials from the Impact Assessment (IA) Division of this Ministry.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is 'Central Civil Services (Revised Pay) Rules, 1960 - Calculation of service for determination of the ceiling limits under rule 12(2)'.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The memorandum is dated 3rd August, 1961.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to provide the method of calculation of service for determination of the ceiling limits under rule 12(2) of the Central Civil Services (Revised Pay) Rules, 1960.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the method of calculation of service mentioned in the memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The method of calculation is that the service of even number of years dated the 10th May, 1961, is to be taken for the purpose of calculation.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the pay scale mentioned in the memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pay scale mentioned is Rs. 7.50 in the case of revised scales ending at Rs. 8.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the pay scale for government servants drawing a pay of Rs 34.50 P.M. or less?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pay scale for such government servants is Rs. 7.75 P.M.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the pay scale for government servants drawing a pay of Rs 35 P.M. or more?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pay scale for such government servants is Rs. 8 P.M.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision for government servants who were drawing pay on the revised scale of Rs 7.75 P.M.?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Such government servants will be entitled, under proviso (ii) of Rule 11, 1959, to the same pay of Rs. 7.75 P.M. as they were drawing on 1st July, 1959.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision for government servants whose pay on the revised scale is fixed at Rs 35 P.M.?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Such government servants will be entitled, under proviso (ii) of Rule 11, 1959, to the same pay of Rs. 35 P.M. as they were drawing on 1st July, 1959.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision for government servants who were drawing pay on the existing scales but whose pay on the revised scale is fixed at a lower stage?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Such government servants will be entitled to the pay of the stage next above the pay on the revised scale.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision for government servants who were drawing pay on the existing scales but whose pay on the revised scale is fixed at a higher stage?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Such government servants will be entitled to the pay of the stage next below the pay on the revised scale.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision for government servants who were drawing pay on the existing scales but whose pay on the revised scale is fixed at the same stage?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Such government servants will be entitled to the same pay as they were drawing on 1st July, 1959.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision for government servants who were drawing pay at lower stages in the existing scales but whose pay on the revised scale is fixed at a higher stage?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Such government servants will be entitled to the pay of the stage next below the pay on the revised scale.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision for government servants who were drawing pay at higher stages in the existing scales but whose pay on the revised scale is fixed at a lower stage?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Such government servants will be entitled to the pay of the stage next above the pay on the revised scale.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the provision for government servants who were drawing pay at the same stage in the existing scales but whose pay on the revised scale is fixed at a different stage?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Such government servants will be entitled to the pay of the stage next below the pay on the revised scale.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 16th Meeting of Protectorate of Emigrants (PoE) Establishment Board to fill up vacancies in the Offices of Protector of Emigrants.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which cities are the vacancies in the Protectorate of Emigrants offices located in?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Agartala, Bengaluru, Bhubaneswar, Chandigarh, Delhi, Hyderabad, Kochi, Mumbai, and Ranchi.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the grades of the vacancies to be filled up?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Deputy Secretary/Under Secretary (minimum pay level-11), Section Officer (minimum pay level-08), and Assistant Section Officers (pay level-07).

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the minimum tenure for the PoE offices?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The tenure in the PoE offices will be for a minimum period of two years on deputation basis.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the functions of the Protectors of Emigrants as per the Emigration Act, 1983?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To protect and advise all intending emigrants, oversee the provisions of the Emigration Act, grant emigration clearance, monitor recruitment activities of RAs and illegal agents, inspect emigrant conveyance, and inquire into the treatment received by emigrants.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the Protectors of Emigrants required to add and advise, as per the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Emigrants who have returned to India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the 16th Meeting of the Protectorate of Emigrants Establishment Board?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To fill up vacancies in the Offices of Protector of Emigrants.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the intended recipients of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (i) All Ministries and Departments of Central Government and (ii) All Ministries and Departments of State Governments.

question_answer_pairs.question: On what basis are the vacancies to be filled up?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Deputation basis.

question_answer_pairs.answer: Further extended as per rules.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is one of the functions of the Protectors of Emigrants related to emigration clearance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Granting emigration clearance to the intending emigrants as per the procedure prescribed under the Emigration Act, 1983.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is one of the functions of the Protectors of Emigrants related to monitoring recruitment activities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Monitoring recruitment activities of RAs, illegal agents under the supervision of the Protector General of Emigrants.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is one of the functions of the Protectors of Emigrants related to inspecting emigrant conveyance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Inspect, to an extent and in a manner as may be prescribed, any emigrant conveyance, or any other conveyance if he has reason to believe that any intending emigrant or emigrants are proceeding from, or returning to, India; to or from a place outside India by such other conveyance.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is one of the functions of the Protectors of Emigrants related to inquiring into the treatment received by emigrants?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Inquire into the treatment received by emigrants during their voyage or journey to, and during the period of their residence in the country to which they emigrated and also during their return voyage or journey to India and report thereon to the Protector General of Emigrants or such other authority as may be prescribed.
