question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the document addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is addressed to the Chief Executive Officer/Managing Director/Secretary of the multi-State cooperative societies.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is the Order of the Hon'ble High Court of Rajasthan at Jodhpur dated 14.05.2015 in D.B. Civil Writ Petition No. 26/2013.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the matter related to in the Order of the Hon'ble High Court of Rajasthan?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Order is related to the matter of Sajjan Singh Bhati (Petitioner) Vs. State of Rajasthan & Ors. (Respondents).

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the Hon'ble High Court of Rajasthan directed in its order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Hon'ble High Court has directed that the multi-State cooperative societies shall accept deposits of any kind and under any scheme from public.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the exception to the above direction?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The exception is that the restriction will not apply for repayment of the deposits for a period of three months. If licenses are obtained within three months under Section 22 of the Banking Regulation Act, 1949, multi-State Cooperative Societies in the State of Rajasthan may be allowed to accept the deposits.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the society directed to do as per the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The society is directed to comply with the above directions as stated in the document.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has signed this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is signed by (Ashish Kumar Bhutan), Joint Secretary (Cooperation) & Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the entities the document is copied to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is copied to the Director General of Police, Rajasthan Police Headquarters Bari Chaupar, Jaipur-302002, the Chief Secretary, Government of Rajasthan, Secretariat, Jaipur-302005, Rajasthan, and the Registrar of Cooperative Societies, Government of Rajasthan, Nehru Shekhar Bhawan, Bhawani Singh Road, Jaipur - 302001.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this document is to convey the directions of the Hon'ble High Court of Rajasthan regarding the acceptance of deposits by multi-State cooperative societies.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which court issued the order mentioned in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The order mentioned in this document is issued by the Hon'ble High Court of Rajasthan at Jodhpur.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the High Court order mentioned in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The High Court order is dated 14.05.2015.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the case number of the High Court order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The case number is D.B. Civil Writ Petition No. 26/2013.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the parties involved in the High Court case?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The parties involved are Sajjan Singh Bhati (Petitioner) and the State of Rajasthan & Ors. (Respondents).

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the main directive given by the High Court in its order?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the Engineering Circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Circular is dated 22nd Aug, 2005.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the Engineering Circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is Surrendering of Document of Compliance (DOC) after incident/accident.

question_answer_pairs.question: What led to the issuance of this Engineering Circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It has come to the notice of the Directorate that after an unfortunate casualty that occurred on a vessel, which led to a person's loss of life and grave injury to another, the company responsible for the Safety Management System on board ship, voluntarily surrendered the Document of Compliance.

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the purpose of surrendering the Document of Compliance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The surrendering of the Document of Compliance was done to enable the additional verification/ISM audit to be initiated.

question_answer_pairs.question: How has this been viewed by the Directorate?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This has been viewed with concern.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the obligation of a company in possession of a Document of Compliance issued by the Directorate?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A company being in possession of a Document of Compliance issued by the Directorate is not only obligated to implement an effective Safety Management System to ensure compliance with mandatory rules and regulations for safe operation of ships and protection of the environment, but also morally responsible for continuation of the Safety Management System of the ship included in the DOC.

question_answer_pairs.question: What does the Directorate reiterate regarding the Ship Manager / Ship Management Company?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Directorate reiterates that the Ship Manager / Ship Management Company should be more proactive in providing evidence as to the 'effectiveness of the Safety Management System' as required by the Code, especially after such incidents / accidents.

question_answer_pairs.question: Under what rules are ship managers / ship management companies informed about their responsibilities pertaining to audit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Under the Merchant Shipping (Management for the Safe Operation of Ships) Rules, 2000, Para 9 - Responsibilities pertaining to Audit, all ship managers / ship management companies are hereby informed that DOC / SMC once issued cannot be voluntarily surrendered after casualty till satisfactory conduct of verification audit and inquiry, as required under M.S. Act 1958 as amended, are completed.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the verification audit and inquiry mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The verification audit and inquiry are required to be completed as per the M.S. Act 1958 as amended, before the DOC / SMC can be voluntarily surrendered after a casualty.

question_answer_pairs.answer: If the declared tariff is Rs. 7000 per unit per day but the amount charged from the customer on account of extra bed is Rs. 8000, GST shall be charged at 18% on Rs. 8000

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the clarification regarding tariff changes between booking and actual usage?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The rate applicable would be the rate prevailing at the time of supply of service

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the clarification regarding GST on websites through which businesses are being procured or printed on tariff card?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Tariff declared anywhere, say on the websites through which business is being procured or printed on tariff card, would be the basis to determine the applicable GST rate

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the clarification regarding the GST rate on betting and gambling in casinos?
question_answer_pairs.answer: GST shall be levied at the rate of 28% on the full face value of the bet or the amount paid into the totalisator

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the clarification regarding the GST rate on admission to cinema?
question_answer_pairs.answer: GST shall be levied at the applicable rate on the price of the cinema ticket

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the fifth clarification mentioned in the document?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the clarification regarding the GST rate on homestays?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the potential impact of this document on the implementation of Non-Plan Schemes/Projects?

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the mandatory qualifications for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The mandatory qualifications include: having worked for at least 2 years at the Centre under the Central Staffing Scheme, the officer should be clear from vigilance angle, the officer should not have been debarred from Central Deputation, the officer should have at least 'Very Good' service record, the officer should not be over 54 years of age, the officer should not have been posted on an assignment in a foreign/captive post of the Government of India earlier, and the officer should have cumulative work experience of at least 2 years in the Ministry of Commerce, Industry, Textiles, Communications and IT of the Government of India or in the State Government in Industry, Commerce and IT Department.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the desirable qualifications for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The desirable qualifications include experience in bilateral/international relations, exposure to International Trade, and officers having work experience in dealing with European Union/European Commission.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the intended recipients of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is addressed to the General Managers (P) of All Indian Railways.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject of the document is 'Promotion of staff in Loco running cadre-relaxation in two years rule - reg.'

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the document is to provide promotion of staff in the Loco running cadre with relaxation in the two-year rule.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the background mentioned for issuing this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Railways are aware of the difficulties being experienced in filling up vacancies of Goods Drivers due to non-availability of Shunters with the two years' service.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the first decision mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The condition of minimum service of two years in the immediate lower grade as Goods Driver was relaxed by the Board under No.E(NG)I-94/PM7/43 dated 1.4.97.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the second decision mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The promotion as Goods Driver in scale Rs.1350-2200, along with juniors in scale Rs.1200-2040, subject to certain conditions, was dispensed with.

question_answer_pairs.question: For what time period were the above decisions extended?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The above decisions were extended from time to time and was last valid upto 30.12.94.

question_answer_pairs.question: What feedback has the Board received from the Railways?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Board has received feedback from the Railways that the problem of shortage of eligible employees for promotion as Goods Driver continues to be faced by the Railways.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Board's decision regarding the two years' service requirement?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Board has decided that the two years' service required as Goods Driver as a minimum for promotion, as it has been decided earlier, should continue.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Board's decision regarding the approval of the GM?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No further approval of the GM is required, up to three months, if so warranted in the administrative interest.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Board's decision regarding the relaxation of the two years' service condition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Board has decided that the two years' service condition may be relaxed by the Railways in other Loco running categories as well with the prior approval of the Board.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason provided for this relaxation?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reason provided is that such relaxation is found to be inescapable in the interest of administration, subject to lower grade being enforced.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Board's decision in case the difficulties are still faced by the Railways?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Board has decided that in case the difficulties are still faced, the Railways may refer the matter to the Board for consideration on a case-to-case basis.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference number mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reference number is No.E(NG)I-94/PM7/16.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the previous letter referred to in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The previous letter is dated 1.4.87.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the content of the previous letter referred to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The previous letter allowed promotion of Electrical Assistants in scale Rs.1350-2200, along with Shunters in scale Rs.1200-2040, subject to certain conditions.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The relaxation was last valid upto 30.12.94.

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the Board revealed regarding the difficulties faced by the Railways?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Board has revealed that the problem of shortage of eligible employees for promotion as Goods Driver continues to be faced by the Railways.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Board's view on the relaxation of the two years' service condition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Board considers that the two years' service condition may be relaxed by the Railways in other Loco running categories as well, with the prior approval of the Board.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason cited for the relaxation of the two years' service condition?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reason cited is that the relaxation is found to be inescapable in the interest of administration, subject to lower grade being enforced.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Board's directive to the Railways regarding referring the matter to the Board?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Board acknowledges that the difficulties are still faced by the Railways and they may refer the matter to the Board for consideration on a case-to-case basis.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Finance, Department of Expenditure issued this office memorandum.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum is dated the 22nd April, 2015.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject of the office memorandum is 'Travel by Premium Trains on Official Duty/Tour/Training/Transfer etc. - Clarification reg.'

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this office memorandum is to provide clarification regarding the entitlement of Central Government servants to travel by 'Premium Trains' on official duty/tour/training/transfer.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the clarification provided in the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The clarification provided is that travel by Premium Trains by Central Government servants on Official Duty/Tour/Training/Transfer etc. is not allowed, and therefore, the fare charged for Premium Trains shall not be reimbursable.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the exceptions mentioned in the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The exceptions mentioned are in cases where journey by Premium Trains has already been performed, the actual fare paid, whatever is less, shall be reimbursable.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maximum amount that can be reimbursed for travel by Premium Trains?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The maximum amount that can be reimbursed for travel by Premium Trains shall be restricted to the admissible normal fare for the journey.

question_answer_pairs.question: To whom is this office memorandum addressed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: This office memorandum is addressed to All Ministries/Departments of Government of India and other Government offices.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has signed this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum is signed by the Under Secretary to the Government of India.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of uploading this office memorandum on the website of the Ministry of Finance is for NIC (National Informatics Centre) to upload the O.M. (Office Memorandum) on the website.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is the Constitution of Task Force for ensuring implementation of Child & Adolescent Labour (Prohibition & Regulation) Act, 1986 and to strategize for the objective of child labour free India.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has decided to set up the Task Force?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It has been decided with the approval of Hon'ble Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Labour & Employment to set up the Task Force.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of setting up the Task Force?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to ensure implementation of the Child & Adolescent Labour (Prohibition & Regulation) Act, 1986 and to strategize for the objective of child labour free India.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Chairperson of the Task Force?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Joint Secretary, Child labour is the Chairperson of the Task Force.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the members of the Task Force?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The members are: Add. Chief Labour Commissioner (C), Representative, Ministry of Home Affairs, Representative, Ministry of Human Resource Development (Dept. of School Education & Literacy), Director/Deputy Secretary, Child Labour Division, Smt. Shashikala Patnaik, Dy. Chief Labour Commissioner (C), Dr. Helen Sekar, Sr. Fellow, V.V.G.N.L.I., Labour Commissioner, Government of Uttar Pradesh, Labour Commissioner, Government of Bihar, Labour Commissioner, Government of Rajasthan, Labour Commissioner, Government of Telangana.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the term of reference (TOR) for the Task Force?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The TOR includes: 1) To formulate strategy for effective enforcement of the Act and smooth implementation of National Child Labour Project (NCLP) Scheme, 2) To monitor action taken on complaints registered on PENCIL Portal and complaints received from other sources including media reports, 3) To prepare a panel of officials from Ministry & CLC(C) / CLS for physical intervention for action against incidence of violation of the Act and to verify the implementation of NCLP Scheme in Districts, 4) To coordinate with State Governments and with other related Ministries of the Central Government for effective enforcement & exploring convergence with.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the PENCIL Portal?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The PENCIL Portal is a platform for monitoring action taken on complaints registered on it.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the National Child Labour Project (NCLP) Scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The NCLP Scheme is a scheme for effective enforcement of the Child & Adolescent Labour (Prohibition & Regulation) Act, 1986.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the Under Secretary, Child Labour Section?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Under Secretary, Child Labour Section is a member of the Task Force.

question_answer_pairs.question: How many members are there in the Task Force?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There are 12 members in the Task Force.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Task Force?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The role of the Task Force is to ensure effective implementation of the Child & Adolescent Labour (Prohibition & Regulation) Act, 1986 and to strategize for the objective of child labour free India.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Representative, Ministry of Human Resource Development (Dept. of School Education & Literacy) is a member of the Task Force.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Inviting application for post of Section Officer on deputation (Foreign Service term basis) in Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) Regional Office at Hyderabad.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the name of the organization issuing this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) is the organization issuing this circular.

question_answer_pairs.question: How many vacancies are available for the post of Section Officer?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There is one vacancy for the post of Section Officer.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the eligibility criteria for the post of Section Officer?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The eligibility criteria include: (i) Officers from the Central Government holding analogous posts on regular basis in the parent cadre/department; (ii) With three years of regular service in the Pay Matrix Level 7; or (iii) With five years of regular service in the Pay Matrix Level 6; or (iv) Officers from State Government/ Public Sector Undertaking/ Autonomous Organization holding regular post in corresponding grades with requisite experience.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the age limit for the post of Section Officer?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The age limit for all the posts mentioned above is that the candidate should be below 56 years of age as on the closing date of the application.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the period of deputation for the post of Section Officer?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The period of deputation shall be for five years. The lending department may relieve an officer for a lesser period as per their own policy/rules, which should not be less than three years in any case.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Regional Office of UIDAI is located at Hyderabad.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The address of the UIDAI Regional Office is Bangla Sahib Road, Behind Kali Mandir, Gole Market, New Delhi - 110001.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is 'Involving Non-Governmental Organisations for spreading awareness about the RTI Act, 2005.'

question_answer_pairs.answer: The State Governments are responsible for developing and organizing educational programmes to advance the understanding of the public about exercising their right to information.

What is the purpose of the notice?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To provide information on the modalities and schedule for Senior Secondary School (Class XII) Examinations, 2020 Only for 'Improvement Category' Candidates.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the three processes mentioned in the notice that candidates need to apply for?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (i) Verification of Marks, (ii) Obtaining Photocopy of the Evaluated Answer Book(s), and (iii) Re-evaluation of Marks.

question_answer_pairs.question: How can candidates apply for these processes?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Requests for all the processes will be accepted only online through Board's website.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the deadline for applying for these processes?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notice does not mention a specific deadline, but states that the application should be made during the specified schedules.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the processing charge for these processes?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The processing charges can only be deposited online (Credit/Debit Card/Net banking).

question_answer_pairs.question: What happens if the application is incomplete or offline?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Incomplete/offline applications will be summarily rejected without any correspondence with the candidate.

question_answer_pairs.question: How many applications per candidate will be accepted for each step?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Only one application per candidate, for each step, will be accepted in online process.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will be responsible for any loss or damage caused to the candidate due to the revision of marks?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Board will not be responsible for any loss or damage or any inconvenience caused to the candidate.

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the outcome of the verification and re-evaluation be?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The outcome of the verification and re-evaluation will be final and binding.

question_answer_pairs.question: Are the processing charges refundable?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, the processing charges are non-refundable.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the impact on marks if there is a decrease?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Decrease even by one mark shall be affected.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where can candidates find more information about the schedules?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notice states that the schedules will be provided along with the website.

question_answer_pairs.question: Can candidates apply for multiple subjects?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notice does not mention any restriction on the number of subjects a candidate can apply for.

question_answer_pairs.question: Is there any option to submit the application offline?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No, the notice clearly states that requests for all the processes will be accepted only online.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the 'Improvement Category' mentioned in the notice?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The notice is specifically for candidates who have appeared for the Senior School Certificate Examination, 2020 in the subjects whose examinations have been conducted by CBSE.

question_answer_pairs.question: According to Section 51 of the CGST Act 2017, what is the threshold for deduction of tax by the Government Agencies (Deductor) or any other person?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The total value of such supply, under a contract, exceeds two lakh and fifty thousand rupees.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the time period within which the deductor has to issue a certificate to the deductee mentioning the contract value, rate of deduction, amount deducted etc
question_answer_pairs.answer: The deductor has to issue a certificate to the deductee within ten days after the end of the month in which such deduction is made.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the responsibility of the deductors as per the Act?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The deductors are entrusted with the responsibility of filing return in FORM GSTR-7 on the common portal for every month in which the tax has been deducted.

question_answer_pairs.question: How should the deductors deposit the tax amount deducted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The deductors shall deposit the tax amount so deducted with the Government account through NEFT to RBI or a cheque to be deposited in one of the authorized banks, using challan on the common portal.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which court order is mentioned in the memorandum?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the court order mentioned?
What has been agreed as per the court order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: That a representative of NEERI shall be included as a Member in the Environmental Appraisal Committee (EAC) and State Environmental Appraisal Committee (SEAC) constituted by Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change for dealing with industrial units falling in TTZ area.

question_answer_pairs.answer: That the Chairperson of the EAC may co-opt an expert as a Member in a relevant field for a particular meeting of the Committee.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the issuing authority of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The issuing authority of this document is Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare, Government of India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this document is to provide guidelines for the implementation of the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) for the Kharif season of 2019-20.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the target group for the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The target group for the PMFBY are all farmers, including sharecroppers and tenant farmers.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subsidy rate for the premium under PMFBY?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subsidy rate for the premium under PMFBY is 100% of the premium for small and marginal farmers.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is responsible for the implementation of PMFBY at the state level?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The State Government is responsible for the implementation of PMFBY at the state level.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the State Government in the implementation of PMFBY?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The State Government is responsible for the selection of insurance companies, notification of crops, and timely payment of claims to the farmers.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the insurance companies in the implementation of PMFBY?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The insurance companies are responsible for the assessment of crop losses, timely payment of claims, and providing necessary information to the farmers.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the timeline for the payment of claims under PMFBY?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The claims under PMFBY should be paid within two weeks of the finalization of the loss assessment.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the mechanism for the redressal of grievances under PMFBY?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The grievances under PMFBY should be addressed through the Grievance Redressal Committee at the district level.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Grievance Redressal Committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Grievance Redressal Committee is responsible for the timely resolution of grievances related to the implementation of PMFBY.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the State Level Monitoring Committee in the implementation of PMFBY?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The State Level Monitoring Committee is responsible for the overall monitoring and review of the implementation of PMFBY in the state.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the District Level Monitoring Committee in the implementation of PMFBY?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The District Level Monitoring Committee is responsible for the monitoring and review of the implementation of PMFBY at the district level.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Village Level Monitoring Committee in the implementation of PMFBY?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Village Level Monitoring Committee is responsible for the monitoring and review of the implementation of PMFBY at the village level.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Nodal Department in the implementation of PMFBY?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Nodal Department is responsible for the overall coordination and monitoring of the implementation of PMFBY in the state.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Nodal Officer in the implementation of PMFBY?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Nodal Officer is responsible for the overall coordination and monitoring of the implementation of PMFBY at the state level.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the District Nodal Officer in the implementation of PMFBY?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The District Nodal Officer is responsible for the overall coordination and monitoring of the implementation of PMFBY at the district level.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Block Nodal Officer in the implementation of PMFBY?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Block Nodal Officer is responsible for the overall coordination and monitoring of the implementation of PMFBY at the block level.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Village Nodal Officer in the implementation of PMFBY?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Village Nodal Officer is responsible for the overall coordination and monitoring of the implementation of PMFBY at the village level.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) in the implementation of PMFBY?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) are used to assess the crop losses for the purpose of claim settlement under PMFBY.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) in the determination of the Threshold Yield?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) are used to determine the Threshold Yield, which is the benchmark for the assessment of crop losses under PMFBY.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) in the determination of the Actual Yield?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) are used to determine the Actual Yield, which is used for the assessment of crop losses under PMFBY.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) in the determination of the Compensation Amount?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) are used to determine the Compensation Amount, which is the amount paid to the farmers under PMFBY.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) in the determination of the Premium Rate?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) are used to determine the Premium Rate, which is the amount paid by the farmers for the insurance coverage under PMFBY.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) in the determination of the Sum Insured?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) are used to determine the Sum Insured, which is the maximum amount that can be paid to the farmers under PMFBY.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) in the determination of the Indemnity Level?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) are used to determine the Indemnity Level, which is the percentage of the Sum Insured that can be paid to the farmers under PMFBY.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) in the determination of the Claim Settlement?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) are used to determine the Claim Settlement, which is the amount paid to the farmers under PMFBY.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) in the determination of the Grievance Redressal?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Crop Cutting Experiments (CCEs) are used to address the grievances related to the implementation of PMFBY.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this document is to provide guidelines for the implementation of the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY) for the Kharif season of 2019-20.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the target group for the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The target group for the PMFBY are all farmers, including sharecroppers and tenant farmers.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subsidy rate for the premium under PMFBY?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subsidy rate for the premium under PMFBY is 100% of the premium for small and marginal farmers.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The claims under PMFBY should be paid within two weeks of the finalization of the loss assessment.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this act?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To make a provision for levy and collection of tax on intra-State supply of goods or services or both by the Union territories and for matters connected therewith or incidental thereto.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which territories does this act extend to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Union territories of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, Lakshadweep, Dadra and Nagar Haveli, Daman and Diu, Chandigarh and other territory.

question_answer_pairs.question: When did this act come into force?
question_answer_pairs.answer: On such date as the Central Government may, by notification in the Official Gazette, appoint.

question_answer_pairs.question: What may be different dates appointed for different provisions of this act?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Provided that different dates may be appointed for different provisions of this Act and any reference in any such provision to the commencement of this Act shall be construed as a reference to the coming into force of that provision.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the definition of 'goods' as per section 2(52)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 'goods' means every kind of movable property other than money and securities but includes actionable claim, growing crops, grass and things attached to or forming part of the land which are agreed to be severed before supply or under a contract of supply;

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the definition of 'services' as per section 2(102)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 'services' means anything other than goods, money and securities but includes activities relating to the use of money or its conversion by cash or by any other mode, from one form, currency or denomination, to another form, currency or denomination for which a separate consideration is charged;

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the definition of 'intra-State supply of goods' as per section 8(1)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Subject to the provisions of section 10, intra-State supply of goods shall be a supply of goods where the location of the supplier and the place of supply of goods are in the same State or Union territory.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the definition of 'intra-State supply of services' as per section 8(2)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Subject to the provisions of section 12, intra-State supply of services shall be a supply of services where the location of the supplier and the place of supply of services are in the same State or Union territory.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the definition of 'Union territory Goods and Services Tax' as per section 2(113)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 'Union territory Goods and Services Tax' means the tax levied under this Act;

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the definition of 'Union territory tax' as per section 2(114)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 'Union territory tax' means the Union territory goods and services tax levied under this Act;

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Filing of Annual Returns for the year 2015-16 under section 120 of MSCS Act, 2002.

question_answer_pairs.question: Under which section of the MSCS Act, 2002 are the multi-state cooperative societies required to file their Annual Returns?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Section 120 of the MSCS Act, 2002.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the deadline for the multi-state cooperative societies to file their Annual Returns for the year 2015-16?
Where should the multi-state cooperative societies upload their Annual Returns?
question_answer_pairs.answer: On the departmental website address www.mscs.dac.gov.in.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the details that the multi-state cooperative societies need to provide while filing their Annual Returns?
question_answer_pairs.answer: a) Annual Returns of the activities; b) Audited statements of accounts along with auditor's report thereon and compliance report of the society; c) Plan for surplus disposal as approved by the General Body; d) List of amendments to the bye-laws of the multi-state cooperative societies; e) Declaration regarding date of holding General Body Meeting and conduct of elections where due date for holding the election to the Board of Directors (BoD).

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the office that has issued this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Office of the Central Registrar of Cooperative Societies.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has issued this circular?

question_answer_pairs.answer: 31st March, 2017.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for issuing this circular?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the consequence of not filing the Annual Returns by the due date?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It has been observed that even after six months have passed from the last date of filing the Annual Returns, many multi-state cooperative societies have not done so. This is a gross violation of the provisions of the Act.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the directive given in this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All the multi-state cooperative societies shall file their returns for the year 2015-16 and upload the same immediately on the departmental website address www.mscs.dac.gov.in latest by 30.04.2017.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum was issued on New Delhi, the 14 December, 1998.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry issued the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum was issued by the Ministry of Finance, Department of Expenditure, E.III-A Branch.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to provide clarification regarding the Central Civil Services (Revised Pay) Rules, 1997.

question_answer_pairs.question: What has been expressed by various Ministries/Departments?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Doubts have been expressed by various Ministries/Departments regarding the manner in which the fixation of pay in the revised scales of Government servants who have been drawing pay at the pre-revised scales is to be regulated.

question_answer_pairs.question: What has been sought in relation to the fixation of pay under the revised scales?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Clarifications have also been sought in regard to the fixation of pay under the revised scales.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the key issue regarding the Efficiency Bar in the pre-revised scales?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It is clarified that fixation of pay in the revised scales may be regulated as indicated below, and the cases where the Efficiency Bar in the pre-revised scales have not been crossed due to administrative reasons.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who may have their pay fixed in the applicable pre-revised scale?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pay of a Government servant who was considered unfit to cross the Efficiency Bar operated in the pre-revised scale before 1.1.1996 may be fixed in the applicable pre-revised scale.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reference to be made for such cases?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Such cases will be dealt with reference to the same immediately preceding such efficiency bar in the pre-revised scale.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the treatment for the cases of Government servants who have crossed the Efficiency Bar in the pre-revised scale?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The cases of such Government servants may, however, be placed before the respective Departmental Promotion Committees in terms of the instructions on the subject.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the basis for determining the pay in the revised scale for those who have not crossed the Efficiency Bar?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pay of such Government servants are to be fixed initially in the applicable pre-revised scale in accordance with the decision of the DPC and thereafter in the corresponding revised scale.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the treatment for the cases where the Efficiency Bar has been crossed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If, however, the Government servant is found fit to cross the Efficiency Bar even after such review, no subsequent review need be made.

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the Japan-East Asia Network of Exchange for Students and Youth Programme (JENESYS) started?
question_answer_pairs.answer: in the year 2007 by the then prime minister of Japan, Mr. H.E. Shinzo Abe

question_answer_pairs.question: How many students are part of the JENESYS programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: around 250 students

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two main components of the JENESYS programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (i) inviting East Asian youths to Japan, (ii) dispatching Japanese youths to East Asia and other exchange programmes

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the objective of the JENESYS programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: to establish a basis of Asia's solidarity through various exchange programmes

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the duration of the 1st batch of visit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 18th November -25th November, 2012

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the duration of the 2nd batch of visit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 25th November -5th December, 2012

question_answer_pairs.question: How many students (boys and girls) are the CBSE schools required to nominate for the JENESYS programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 125 boys and 125 girls

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the age group of the students who can participate in the JENESYS programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 14-18 years

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the physical requirement for the students to participate in the JENESYS programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: They must be physically fit to undertake field trips and tours in Japan

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the social requirement for the students to participate in the JENESYS programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: They must be mentally agile and be creative enough to interact with other students and participate in debates etc.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the expected behavior of the participating students?
question_answer_pairs.answer: They are expected to be highly disciplined, upholding values of punctuality and adherence to rules and regulations

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the additional emphasis on the participating students?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It is further emphasized that they should abstain from smoking and drinking

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the requirement for the selected students?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The students so selected should have either applied for or should be holding a passport

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the preference criteria mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Preference may be given to those schools from which students had not participated in the earlier JENESYS programme including students from SC/ST/OBC category

question_answer_pairs.question: How many teachers are required to accompany the students for the JENESYS programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: one teacher for every 15 students

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the JENESYS programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: to deepen mutual understanding among young people who will assume important roles in the next generation in respective countries

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the Principals of the schools requested to send entries for the JENESYS programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Principals of the schools affiliated to CBSE are requested to send entries

question_answer_pairs.question: How many students (one boy and one girl) are the Principals required to send from their schools?
question_answer_pairs.answer: two students (one boy and one girl)

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of sending the required details for processing at the end?
question_answer_pairs.answer: for processing at the end

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the age group of the students who can participate in the JENESYS programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: 14-18 years (studying in classes IX to XII)

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Level 'B' Training programme at ISTM for Assistant Section Officers (ASOs) of the CSS for promotion to Section Officer Grade from 22/07/2019 to 23/08/2019 (35 days batch).

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the undersigned in the Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The undersigned is not explicitly mentioned in the image.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Office Memorandum is dated 19th July, 2019.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the Office Memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to inform officers whose names are given in Annexure I about the Level 'B' Training Programme conducted by ISTM from 22/07/2019 to 23/08/2019.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where will the training programme be conducted?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The training programme will be conducted at ISTM, Administrative Block, JNU Campus (Old), New Delhi-110067.

question_answer_pairs.question: What time will the training programme start on 22nd July, 2019?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The training programme will start at 9.00 A.M. on 22nd July, 2019.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the duration of the training programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The training programme is for 35 days, from 22/07/2019 to 23/08/2019.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of evaluating the performance of the officials during the training?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The performance of the officials in the training is evaluated and reported by ISTM to be considered for their promotion.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the policy regarding withdrawal/exemption from the training programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: No withdrawal/exemption either from the Ministry/Department or the officer concerned shall be entertained except on the grounds indicated in DoPT OM No.T-25011/1/2015-Trg (ISTM Section) dated 4th July, 2016.

question_answer_pairs.question: Is vigilance clearance required for the training programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Vigilance clearance is not required for mandatory training programmes, as the Cadre Units are requested to ensure that the officials nominated to the above training programme are relieved in time.

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the Revised Training Policy for Central Secretariat Service (CSS) and Central Secretariat Stenographers Service (CSSS) issued?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Revised Training Policy was issued vide DoPT's OM No. T-25017/1/2015-Trg (ISTM Section) dated 4th July, 2016.

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the earlier policy regarding the maximum number of chances for mandatory training at various levels of CSS?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The earlier policy had a maximum of 3 to 2 chances, which has now been reduced to a maximum of 2 chances.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the new policy regarding the maximum number of chances for mandatory training at various levels of CSS?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The new policy allows a maximum of 2 chances for mandatory training at various levels of CSS.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the consequence for officers who do not attend or successfully complete the Level 'B' training programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The officers who do not attend or successfully complete the Level 'B' training programme will be liable to debarment and denial of promotion as envisaged in DoPT OM No.T-25017/1/2015-Trg (ISTM Section) dated 4th July, 2016.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the training programme is for the promotion of the Assistant Section Officers (ASOs) of the CSS to the Section Officer Grade.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To provide instructions regarding the withholding of increments at the efficiency bar in a time-scale.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the authority empowered to withhold increments under the government servants' disciplinary rules?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The authority which has the power to make substantive appointments to the post held by the delinquent government servant.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the rule that allows the authority to withhold increments?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Rule 20 of the CCS (CCA) Rules, 1965.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of withholding increments as per this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To impose a penalty on government servants.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two types of government servants mentioned in this office memorandum on whom increments can be withheld?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (i) Government servants on deputation from State Governments to the Central Government and (ii) Government servants on deputation from one Central Government Department/Service to another Central Government Department/Service.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The President.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The CCS (CCA) Rules, 1965.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason given for withholding increments?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Unsatisfactory government service.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the impact of withholding increments on the employee's pay?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It would be the authority concerned to decide about the cross the E.B. in other words, in respect of a future increment.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the impact of withholding increments on the employee's deputation (duty) allowance?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The deputation (duty) allowance in accordance with the extant orders, it will be for the State Government concerned to consider the question of allowing him to cross the E.B.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Guidelines/instructions regarding composition of selection Committee for promotion from Scale VI to Scale VII.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The date of this document is 16th April 2012.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which government department issued this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Department of Financial Services, Ministry of Finance, Government of India issued this document.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is the address of the issuing department located?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The address is 3rd floor, Jeevan Deep Building, Parliament Street, New Delhi - 110001.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the intended recipient of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is addressed to the Managing Directors and CEOs of nationalized banks.

question_answer_pairs.question: How many members are to be included in the selection committee for promotion from Scale VI to Scale VII?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The selection committee shall have 4 members.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the 4 members of the selection committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: (1) Managing Director and CEO (equivalent Executive Director in case of existing MD and CEO), (2) Government nominee Director, (3) RBI nominee Director, and (4) Two experts, of which at least one should be from category 'A', to be nominated by the bank's Board, having the following qualification/experience.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the qualifications required for the two expert members of the selection committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The two expert members should have (a) experience at the level of Higher Administrative Grade or (b) an academician from a premier institute, with at least 5 years of experience in the field of personnel or equivalent in the field of finance, economics or business management.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the signatory of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is signed by B.P. Kanungo, Deputy Secretary to the Government of India.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the contact information provided in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The contact information provided is Tel: (011) 23062113 and Email: bp.kanungo@nic.in.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the other recipients mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The other recipients mentioned are Governor, Reserve Bank of India and Government nominee Directors on the Boards of nationalized banks.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to convey the composition of the selection committee for promotion from Scale VI to Scale VII in nationalized banks.

question_answer_pairs.question: How many categories of members are there in the selection committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: There are 4 categories of members in the selection committee.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the Managing Director and CEO in the selection committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Managing Director and CEO (or equivalent Executive Director in case of existing MD and CEO) is a member of the selection committee.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who nominates the Government nominee Director on the selection committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Government nominates the Government nominee Director.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who nominates the RBI nominee Director on the selection committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The RBI nominates the RBI nominee Director.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the qualification requirement for the two expert members of the selection committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The two expert members should have experience at the level of Higher Administrative Grade or be an academician from a premier institute with at least 5 years of experience in the field of personnel or equivalent in the field of finance, economics or business management.

question_answer_pairs.question: How many of the two expert members should be from category 'A'?
question_answer_pairs.answer: At least one of the two expert members should be from category 'A'.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of including the two expert members in the selection committee?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The two expert members are to be nominated by the bank's Board, having the following qualification/experience.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The introduction of Open Text-based Assessment in the Summative Assessment II of Class IX and in the Annual Examination of Class XI, March 2014.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is dated 6th August, 2013.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the circular number mentioned in the document?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the weightage of the OTBA (Open Text-based Assessment) section in the total paper of summative assessment?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The OTBA section will be of 10 marks, and the total paper of summative assessment will be of 100 marks.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the percentage weightage of the OTBA section in the total paper of summative assessment?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The weightage of the OTBA section will be 10% of the total paper.

question_answer_pairs.question: How many marks are allocated for the question papers in main subjects at Summative Assessment II of Class IX?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The question papers in main subjects at Summative Assessment II of Class IX will be of 70 marks (in English) and 20 marks for ASL (Aural-Spoken Language).

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the total marks for the question paper in each main subject at Summative Assessment II of Class IX?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The total marks for the question paper in each main subject at Summative Assessment II of Class IX will be 90 marks.

question_answer_pairs.question: How many marks are allocated for the OTBA section in each main subject at Summative Assessment II of Class IX?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The OTBA section in each main subject will have a separate section of 10 marks.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the total number of marks for the Summative Assessment II of Class IX?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The total paper of summative assessment in a subject will be of 100 marks.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the percentage weightage of the ASL (Aural-Spoken Language) section in the total paper of Summative Assessment II of Class IX?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The ASL section will have a weightage of 20 marks out of the total 90 marks, which is approximately 22.22%.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the OTBA (Open Text-based Assessment) section in the Summative Assessment II of Class IX and the Annual Examination of Class XI?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The OTBA section is intended to assess higher-order thinking skills requiring students to apply learnings to the situations given in the article/report/case study and draw inferences/conclusions.

question_answer_pairs.question: How many questions will be there in the OTBA section of each main subject?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The OTBA section will comprise of 2-3 questions based on the text.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the questions based on text in the OTBA section?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The questions based on text in the OTBA section are intended to assess higher-order thinking skills requiring students to apply learnings to the situations given in the article/report/case study and draw inferences/conclusions.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The open text material and sample questions for both the classes IX & XI will be made available to the schools by September 2013.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject is 'Environmental Clearance of Projects under the EIA Notification, 2006 and related matters - Procedure for submissions of files and level of decision making - Regarding.'

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to provide a system for submission of files and levels of decision making related to Environmental Clearance under the EIA Notification, 2006.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the activities listed in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The activities listed are: Constitution of State Level Environment Assessment Authorities (SEIAA) and State Expert Appraisal Committee (SEAC), Notifications and their amendments, Category 'A' projects under EIA, 2006, and Category 'B' Projects under EIA, 2006.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the route of submission for Constitution of State Level Environment Assessment Authorities (SEIAA) and State Expert Appraisal Committee (SEAC)?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject of the document is Recruitment to the post of Senior Technical Assistant (Fisheries) in Level-7 of the Pay Matrix (Pay Band-2: Rs. 9300-34800 plus Grade Pay of Rs. 4600).

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the essential qualifications required for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The essential qualifications required are a Master's Degree in Zoology with specialization in Fisheries, or M.F.Sc., or M.Sc. in Marine Biology or University or Institute recognized for M.Sc. in Aquaculture or in Fisheries Science from a recognized University or Statutory or Autonomous Organization or Private Sector.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the experience requirement for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The experience requirement is two years of experience in Fisheries Research or work experience in the field of Fisheries (inland or Marine or Aquaculture) from a Central or State Government Department or Public Sector Undertaking or Recognized Research Institute or semi-Government or Statutory or Autonomous Organization or Private Sector.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the pay scale for the post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The pay scale for the post is Level-7 of the Pay Matrix (Pay Band-2: Rs. 9300-34800 plus Grade Pay of Rs. 4600).

question_answer_pairs.answer: The note mentions that the Departmental Fisheries Research Investigator (Ordinary Grade) in the scale of pay of PB-1: Rs. 5200-20200 with Grade Pay of Rs. 2800 with ten years regular service will also be considered along with the departmental candidates selected for appointment to the post.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is signed by an officer.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this document is to announce the recruitment of Senior Technical Assistant (Fisheries) in Level-7 of the Pay Matrix.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the different types of candidates that can apply for this post?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document mentions that the post can be filled by promotion from among the officers of the Central or State or UT Administration or Autonomous bodies or recognized Research Institutes or Universities or Statutory Bodies.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The method of appointment is through promotion.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is addressed to All Category - I Authorised Dealer Banks.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the main topic of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The main topic of the circular is the Liberalised Remittance Scheme - Harmonisation of Data and Definitions.

question_answer_pairs.question: According to the circular, what has been decided regarding the furnishing of Permanent Account Number (PAN)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that furnishing of Permanent Account Number (PAN), which hitherto was not to be insisted upon while putting through permissible current account transactions of up to USD 25,000, shall now be mandatory for making all remittances under Liberalised Remittance Scheme (LRS).

question_answer_pairs.question: How has the definition of 'relative' been aligned in the context of remittances allowed under LRS?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that the definition of 'relative' has been aligned with the definition given in the Companies Act, 2013 instead of the Companies Act, 1956.

question_answer_pairs.question: What Master Direction is being updated to reflect the changes mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular states that Master Direction No. 7/2015-16 dated January 01, 2016 on LRS is being updated simultaneously to reflect the above changes.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the directions contained in this circular issued under?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The directions contained in this circular have been issued under Sections 10(4), 11(1) and 11(2) of the Foreign Exchange Management Act, 1999.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the changes mentioned in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the changes is to harmonize the data and definitions related to the Liberalised Remittance Scheme.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has signed the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is signed by Shekhar Bhatnagar, Chief General Manager in Charge.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Permanent Account Number (PAN) requirement for remittances under the Liberalised Remittance Scheme (LRS)?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Furnishing of PAN is now mandatory for making all remittances under the LRS.

question_answer_pairs.question: How has the definition of 'relative' been updated in the context of the LRS?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The definition of 'relative' has been aligned with the definition given in the Companies Act, 2013 instead of the Companies Act, 1956.

question_answer_pairs.question: When did the lockdown due to the COVID-19 pandemic occur?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The lockdown occurred in March 2020.

question_answer_pairs.question: What did the Ministry of Civil Aviation issue from time to time after the lockdown?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Civil Aviation issued guidelines for operators, passengers, and other stakeholders to ensure smooth conduct of air operations, safety, and hygiene of the travelling passengers.

question_answer_pairs.question: How often have the guidelines been modified and released?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The guidelines have been modified and released periodically as per the severity of the pandemic, in consultation with the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare (MoHFW).

question_answer_pairs.question: Which other authorities have also issued guidelines for the stakeholders within their respective domains?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA), Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (BCAS), etc. have also issued guidelines for the stakeholders.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for the review of the COVID-19 guidelines mentioned in the order?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reason is the sustained declining COVID-19 trajectory and significant advances made in COVID-19 vaccination coverage both globally as well as in India.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is dated July 24, 2020.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the circular addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular is addressed to Non-Banking Financial Companies and Asset Reconstruction Companies implementing Indian Accounting Standards.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the main topic of the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The main topic of the circular is the implementation of Indian Accounting Standards.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which paragraph of the Annex is referenced in the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Paragraph 3 of the Annex to the circular dated March 13, 2020 is referenced.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the key instruction regarding net unrealized gains on fair valuation of financial instruments?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Any net unrealized gains arising on fair valuation of financial instruments should not be included in owned funds, whereas all such net losses should be considered.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the decision regarding the offset of unrealized gain/loss on a derivative transaction undertaken for hedging?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It has been decided that the unrealized gain/loss on a derivative transaction undertaken for hedging may be offset against the unrealized loss/gain recognized in the capital (either through Profit or Loss or through Other Comprehensive Income) on the corresponding underlying hedged instrument.

question_answer_pairs.question: What should be excluded from regulatory capital as per the circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: If after such offset and netting with unrealized gains/losses on other financial instruments, there are still net unrealized gains, the same should be excluded from regulatory capital as required by paragraph 3 of the annex to the said circular.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is clarified regarding the treatment of unrealized gains/losses for taxation purposes?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It is also clarified that unrealized gains/losses shall be considered net of the effect of taxation.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is addressed to All the Administrative Secretaries to Government Haryana, All Heads of the Departments of Haryana, Commissioners Ambala/Hisar/Rohtak/Gurgaon/Karnal/Faridabad Divisions, All the Deputy Commissioners of Haryana, and All MDs of Boards/Corporations in State of Haryana.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the subject of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The subject of the document is Regarding sending the requisition in respect of Group-D posts to HSSC.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the document is to invite attention to the subject noted above and to say that the process of recruitment to Group-D posts initiated in the year 2014 has been closed and the notice to this effect has been published in the news papers.

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the Haryana Group-D Employees (Recruitment and Conditions of Service) Act, 2018 done?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Haryana Group-D Employees (Recruitment and Conditions of Service) Act, 2018 has come into force which provides for recruitment to Group-D posts through the HSSC.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the major provisions of the Act mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The major provisions of the Act mentioned are: a) Uniform clearly defined minimum age i.e 18, b) Minimum educational qualification as Matric, c) Applies to all Group-D posts except sweeper, chowkidar and sweeper-cum-chowkidar, d) Uniform selection criteria : 100 marks evaluation (wherein 80 marks are for written test and 20 marks for socio-economic criteria and experience), e) Waiting list upto 25% of advertised vacancies when vacancies are 25-50, the waiting list shall be 10%; subject to minimum of two candidates.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the Haryana Staff Selection Commission (HSSC) directed to do?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The HSSC is directed to send their requisition to all departments to withdraw the requisition of Group-D posts sent to the Haryana Staff Selection Commission in pursuance of the office letter No. 42/03/2016-4GSI, dated 22.12.2017 and issue a fresh requisition of Group-D posts direct to Haryana Staff Selection Commission in accordance with provisions of Haryana Group-D Employees (Recruitment and Conditions of Service) Act, 2018.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is dated 28.03.2018.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who has signed the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is signed by Superintendent General Services-I, for Chief Secretary to Government Haryana.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of sending a copy of the document to the Secretary of Haryana Staff Selection Commission?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The copy of the document is forwarded to the Secretary of Haryana Staff Selection Commission for information and necessary action.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the minimum age requirement for Group-D posts as per the Act?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The minimum age requirement for Group-D posts as per the Act is 18 years.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the minimum educational qualification for Group-D posts as per the Act?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The minimum educational qualification for Group-D posts as per the Act is Matric.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which Group-D posts are exempted from the provisions of the Act?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The sweeper, chowkidar and sweeper-cum-chowkidar posts are exempted from the provisions of the Act.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the selection criteria for Group-D posts as per the Act?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The selection criteria for Group-D posts as per the Act is 100 marks evaluation, wherein 80 marks are for written test and 20 marks are for socio-economic criteria and experience.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the waiting list policy as per the Act?
question_answer_pairs.answer: As per the Act, the waiting list shall be up to 25% of advertised vacancies when vacancies are 25-50, and the waiting list shall be 10% subject to a minimum of two candidates.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the Commissioners mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Commissioners mentioned are Ambala, Hisar, Rohtak, Gurgaon, Karnal, and Faridabad.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of the document is to withdraw the previous requisition of Group-D posts sent to the Haryana Staff Selection Commission and issue a fresh requisition in accordance with the Haryana Group-D Employees (Recruitment and Conditions of Service) Act, 2018.

question_answer_pairs.question: When was the previous requisition of Group-D posts sent to the Haryana Staff Selection Commission?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for withdrawing the previous requisition and issuing a fresh one?

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular memo?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to streamline the process and finalize the issues related to seniority for the circle/unit officers.

question_answer_pairs.question: What was the provisional seniority list of Assistant Engineers that was placed on the web site?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The provisional seniority list of Assistant Engineers from the year 1990 to 2011 was placed on the web site on 18.09.2015.

question_answer_pairs.question: After disposing of the objections, when was the seniority list finalized and placed on the web site?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The seniority list was finalized on 16.02.2016 and placed on the web site.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the attention drawn to in this circular memo?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The attention of all the circle/unit officers is drawn to the above seniority list, wherein, probation not declared were mentioned against several Assistant Engineers of Zone V and Zone VI.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason for the delay in sending the proposals for declaration of probation from the circle/unit officers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The delay is due to finalizing the issues related to seniority, particularly declaration of probation, which is mandatory for promotion to the next higher category.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the officers requested to obtain and furnish from the Assistant Engineers listed in the annexure?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The officers are requested to obtain and furnish the proposals for declaration of probation of the A.Es, a copy of the order for declaration of probation if already issued, and the entries of service book.
