question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The date of this document is 08 May 2023.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the circular number mentioned in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The circular number mentioned is Circular No. 16/2023 dated 24.03.2023.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this circular?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to provide clarification regarding the applicability of the provisions of Section 16(4) of the CGST Act, 2017.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the time period mentioned in this document for which the clarification is applicable?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The clarification is applicable for the period from 01.07.2017 to 31.03.2023.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the threshold limit mentioned in this document for the purpose of the clarification?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The threshold limit is 16,000 per month for the period from 01.07.2017 to 16.06.2022.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the new threshold limit mentioned in this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The new threshold limit is 16,000 per quarter for the period from 17.06.2022 onwards.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the reason mentioned for the change in threshold limit?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The reason mentioned is to provide relief to the taxpayers.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the impact of the clarification on the taxpayers?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The clarification will provide relief to the taxpayers by reducing the compliance burden.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the date from which the new threshold limit of 16,000 per quarter is applicable?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The new threshold limit of 16,000 per quarter is applicable from 17.06.2022 onwards.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the impact of the clarification on the taxpayers who have already paid the tax for the period from 01
question_answer_pairs.answer: The taxpayers who have already paid the tax for the period from 01.07.2017 to 16.06.2022 can claim a refund of the excess tax paid.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the deadline mentioned in this document for claiming the refund?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The deadline for claiming the refund is 31.03.2024.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the impact of the clarification on the taxpayers who have not paid the tax for the period from 01
question_answer_pairs.answer: The taxpayers who have not paid the tax for the period from 01.07.2017 to 16.06.2022 will not be required to pay the tax.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the impact of the clarification on the taxpayers who have already filed their returns for the period from 01
question_answer_pairs.answer: The taxpayers who have already filed their returns for the period from 01.07.2017 to 16.06.2022 can file a revised return to claim the refund.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the impact of the clarification on the taxpayers who have not filed their returns for the period from 01
question_answer_pairs.answer: The taxpayers who have not filed their returns for the period from 01.07.2017 to 16.06.2022 can file their returns to claim the refund.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the impact of the clarification on the taxpayers who have already paid the tax for the period from 17
question_answer_pairs.answer: The taxpayers who have already paid the tax for the period from 17.06.2022 onwards can claim a refund of the excess tax paid.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the deadline mentioned in this document for claiming the refund for the period from 17
question_answer_pairs.answer: The deadline for claiming the refund for the period from 17.06.2022 onwards is 31.03.2024.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The taxpayers who have not paid the tax for the period from 17.06.2022 onwards will not be required to pay the tax.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The taxpayers who have already filed their returns for the period from 17.06.2022 onwards can file a revised return to claim the refund.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the impact of the clarification on the taxpayers who have not filed their returns for the period from 17
question_answer_pairs.answer: The taxpayers who have not filed their returns for the period from 17.06.2022 onwards can file their returns to claim the refund.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the CPSC Journal on TVET?
question_answer_pairs.answer: To generate informative, innovative, best practices, and research-based papers or original research articles on TVET.

question_answer_pairs.question: What types of content does the journal seek to publish?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Case studies, reviews, or report articles, papers presented in TVET conferences, or compilation of current information covering issues, trends, and developments in TVET in the Asia-Pacific Region.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the format required for submitting papers/articles to the journal?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Electronic format with a limit of 5,000 words, including figures and illustrations.

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the submitted papers/articles be reviewed?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Through a blind review process involving a panel of qualified TVET experts.

question_answer_pairs.question: How can authors submit their papers/articles?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Through the email of CPSC's Research, Publications and Information Division or through the SLIS Online Journal System.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the document number and date of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document number is No.G-20013/1/2012-CL and it is dated February, 2014.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry issued this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Labour & Employment (Child Labour Division) issued this office memorandum.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where is the office located that issued this memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The office is located at Shram Shakti Bhavan, New Delhi.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose is to inform about the ongoing Plan Scheme National Child Labour Project for elimination of Child Labour, which is being reviewed to bring about structural changes for realignment of the scheme with the Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act, 2009.

question_answer_pairs.question: What has been constituted in this regard?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A working group consisting of members from various Ministries and State Governments has been constituted in this regard.

question_answer_pairs.question: When did the State Labour Secretaries Meeting take place?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The State Labour Secretaries Meeting took place on 30.01.2014.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the status of the process of finalization and issue of the revised guidelines?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The process of finalization and issue of the revised guidelines is underway.

question_answer_pairs.question: Until when is the operation of the National Child Labour Project Scheme (NCLPS) extended?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The operation of NCLPS is hereby extended till the revised guidelines are issued or till 30.09.2014, whichever is earlier.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who are the recipients listed for this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The recipients listed are All State Principal Secretaries (Labour), District Magistrates/Deputy Commissioners-cum-Chairman of NCLPs, Planning Commission, Yojana Bhavan, Deputy Secretary (PF.II), Department of Expenditure, Ministry of Finance, North Block, New Delhi, PS to LEM, PSD to Secretary (L&E), ISAEA, Ministry of Labour & Employment, All Divisions of Ministry of Labour & Employment, and NIC, MoLE with request to place the order on the website under Child Labour Division of the Ministry for information.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who signed this office memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The office memorandum is signed by Harsh Mander, Deputy Secretary.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the ongoing Plan Scheme mentioned in the memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The ongoing Plan Scheme is the National Child Labour Project.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of reviewing the National Child Labour Project scheme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The scheme is being reviewed to bring about structural changes for realignment with the Right of Children to Free and Compulsory Education Act, 2009.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who constituted the working group mentioned in the memorandum?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The working group was constituted by the Ministry.

question_answer_pairs.question: What were the recommendations of the working group shared in the State Labour Secretaries Meeting?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The recommendations of the working group were shared in the State Labour Secretaries Meeting on 30.01.2014.

question_answer_pairs.answer: Physical Education Programme in Primary Schools.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the circular addressed to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: All the Heads of CBSE Affiliated Schools.

question_answer_pairs.question: When was this circular issued?
question_answer_pairs.answer: It was dated 20/11/2009.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the circular number?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Circular No.: 57.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the objectives of the Physical Education Programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The objectives are listed as 1) to offer support by introducing new teaching approaches and activities for primary age group physical education lessons, 2) to provide a new range of educational resources for Physical Education, 3) to offer training to all of the primary staff who deliver primary physical education lessons, 4) to assist schools to deliver elements of the Physical Education curricula, and 5) to act as a research based project that will demonstrate the wider benefits that Physical Education can have on the whole child education outcomes.

question_answer_pairs.question: What has the CBSE produced for schools?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The CBSE has produced a Physical Education Teacher Training Manual and a set of Physical Education Cards for schools affiliated to CBSE.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the Physical Education Cards meant for?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Physical Education Cards are meant for teachers teaching at the primary level and are an effective tool for strengthening the transaction of Physical Education in schools.

question_answer_pairs.question: How can the Physical Education Cards be used?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Physical Education Cards can be used for providing inclusive and interesting experiences to the children at the primary school stage and facilitating the process of engaging with them intensively in games and activities focused particularly on agility, balance, coordination, speed and strength.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is each Physical Education Card devoted to?
question_answer_pairs.answer: Each Physical Education Card is devoted to a particular set up activities which aim at agility, balance and coordination for classes I-II and V.

question_answer_pairs.question: What features make these teaching-aid material special?
question_answer_pairs.answer: These features make this teaching-aid material special and have convinced the stakeholders that if these Cards are used effectively, the transaction of this curricular area will result in achieving desired outcomes leading to behavioural modification.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which government body has collaborated with the CBSE for this Physical Education Programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The British Council and the Government of India have collaborated with the CBSE for this Physical Education Programme.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the aim of the Physical Education Programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The aim is to strengthen the delivery of the Physical Education in the primary school based on specially designed cards and sports equipment for the different age groups from classes 1 to 5.

question_answer_pairs.question: How many classes does the Physical Education Programme cover?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Physical Education Programme covers classes 1 to 5.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the research based project mentioned in the objectives?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The research based project aims to demonstrate the wider benefits that Physical Education can have on the whole child education outcomes.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will receive the training on the Physical Education lessons?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The training will be offered to all of the primary staff who deliver primary physical education lessons.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the role of the schools in this programme?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The schools are expected to assist in delivering elements of the Physical Education curricula.

question_answer_pairs.question: What type of resources will be provided for Physical Education?
question_answer_pairs.answer: A new range of educational resources for Physical Education will be provided.

question_answer_pairs.answer: New teaching approaches and activities will be introduced for primary age group physical education lessons.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Physical Education Cards will facilitate the process of engaging with the children at the primary school stage intensively in games and activities.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Physical Education Cards focus particularly on agility, balance, coordination, speed and strength.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Physical Education Cards are designed for classes I-II and V.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The features make this teaching-aid material special and have convinced the stakeholders that if these Cards are used effectively, the transaction of this curricular area will result in achieving desired outcomes leading to behavioural modification.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The British Council and the Government of India have collaborated with the CBSE.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The aim is to strengthen the delivery of the Physical Education in the primary school based on specially designed cards and sports equipment.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of this document is to provide information about the 'Physical Efficiency Test (PET)' for the academic session 2013-14.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the full form of 'PET' mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: PET stands for 'Physical Efficiency Test'.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who is the target audience for this document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The document is addressed to the Heads of all CBSE affiliated schools.

question_answer_pairs.question: How many marks are allocated for the PET in the academic session 2013-14?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The PET is allocated 10 marks for the academic session 2013-14.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the components of the PET mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The components of the PET are 50 meter run, 600 meter run, and 4x10 meter shuttle run.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the time limit for the 50 meter run?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The time limit for the 50 meter run is 8 seconds.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the time limit for the 600 meter run?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The time limit for the 600 meter run is 2 minutes 30 seconds.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the time limit for the 4x10 meter shuttle run?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The time limit for the 4x10 meter shuttle run is 12 seconds.

question_answer_pairs.question: What are the two types of physical activities mentioned in the document?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The two types of physical activities mentioned are 'Yoga' and 'Aerobics'.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of including Yoga and Aerobics in the PET?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of including Yoga and Aerobics is to make the PET more comprehensive and inclusive.

question_answer_pairs.question: How many physical activities are included in the PET?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The PET includes 5 physical activities: 50 meter run, 600 meter run, 4x10 meter shuttle run, Yoga, and Aerobics.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the maximum score that a student can obtain in the PET?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The maximum score that a student can obtain in the PET is 50.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the minimum score required to pass the PET?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The minimum score required to pass the PET is 21.

question_answer_pairs.question: Who will conduct the PET for the schools?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The PET will be conducted by the Physical Education Teachers of the respective schools.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of conducting the PET?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The purpose of conducting the PET is to assess the physical fitness and efficiency of the students.

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the PET scores be used?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The PET scores will be used for the overall assessment and evaluation of the students.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the PET in the overall assessment of the students?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The PET is an important component of the overall assessment and evaluation of the students.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the deadline for the schools to conduct the PET?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The schools are required to conduct the PET by 30 April, 2014.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the purpose of the PET in the overall development of the students?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The PET is aimed at promoting physical fitness and overall development of the students.

question_answer_pairs.question: How will the PET scores be used for the students' admission in higher education institutions?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The PET scores will be considered for the admission of the students in higher education institutions.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The Physical Education Teachers are responsible for conducting the PET and ensuring its proper implementation.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the significance of the PET in the overall curriculum of the schools?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The PET is an integral part of the overall curriculum and assessment framework of the schools.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The PET will contribute to the physical, mental, and overall development of the students.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The PET is aimed at promoting a healthy and active lifestyle among the students.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The PET will help in identifying and nurturing the athletic talent among the students.

question_answer_pairs.answer: The school administration is responsible for ensuring the proper implementation of the PET.

question_answer_pairs.answer: Apprentices are recruited by the Railways for training and subject to against the working posts after successful completion of training for the time and conditions of the Apprenticeship programme.

question_answer_pairs.question: What organization has invited nominations for the UNESCO-Emir Jaber Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah Prize for Digital Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Indian National Commission for Cooperation with UNESCO has invited nominations for the UNESCO-Emir Jaber Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah Prize for Digital Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities.

question_answer_pairs.question: Which ministry is responsible for forwarding the nominations to UNESCO?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The Ministry of Human Resources Development, Department of Higher Education is responsible for forwarding the nominations to UNESCO.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the deadline for submitting the nominations?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The nominations should be forwarded to the Indian National Commission for Cooperation with UNESCO (INCCU) by 15th September, 2016.

question_answer_pairs.question: Where should the nominations be sent?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The nominations should be sent directly to UNESCO at the following address for further consideration and onward transmission to UNESCO Headquarters, Paris, France.

question_answer_pairs.answer: Mr. Sami Kumar Choudhary, Section Officer (INCCU), Ministry of Human Resource Development, is the contact person for submitting the nominations.

question_answer_pairs.question: What is the contact information for Mr. Sami Kumar Choudhary?
question_answer_pairs.answer: The contact information for Mr. Sami Kumar Choudhary is Room No. 203, C Wing, Dr. Rajendra Prasad Road, Shastri Bhavan, New Delhi - 110115, Contact No. Tele: 011-23384442, E-mail: inccu@nic.in.
